DESCRIPTION: This is a beautiful bottle of 1952 vintage Macallan. It was distilled in 1952 and aged in a Sherry cask for an impressive 49 years, in cask 1250, before being bottled in 2002 at 48% ABV. This bottle is an impressive vintage release from The Macallan Fine & Rare series. It comes with a smart wooden presentation case.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Macallan - 30 Year Old Single Cask 1988 - Mizunara Finish
BOTTLER: East Asia Whisky Co in partnership with Japan Whiskys
DESCRIPTION:
The Speyside region is renowned for making some of the best Single Malt Whiskies in the world, especially at The Macallan Distillery.
Whiskies from Macallan achieved global acclaim for their perfectly balanced flavours and unparalleled depth and complexity. This particular 1988 release sought to challenge the norm and be the first to create a Highland Single Cask Whisky from the Macallan Distillery finished in Japanese Oak, i.e. Mizunara.
After ageing for over 29 years, the spirit was reracked to spend the remainder of its maturation in carefully selected virgin Mizunara Oak that had aged over 200 years...
An endeavour that to this day has never been undertaken, simply due to the risks and uncertainties around flavour and leakage. Supported by a team of experts from Scotland who carefully monitored the whisky along every step of its maturation, the perfect moment in time where the marriage between this legendary spirit and the mysterious Mizunara Oak yielded an outcome with the perfect balance of Scottish Single Malt Whisky character and Japanese Oak influence was found.
Bottled by East Asia Whisky Co in partnership with Japan Whiskys, who are behind other unique bottles such as the Chichibu Warrior Series No. I
This is bottle number 23 of only 50 bottles.

An American 3D artist Fazzino designed this bottle and on the back of the bottle created the Japanese snow scene.
At 35 years old, this very rare bottle of Karuizawa which was distilled in 1981 and bottled in 2017 from Cask #6412 is extremely saught after. 
505 bottles have been produced.

A landmark bottling from the Brora distillery. Distilled in 1978 released in celebration for the 200th anniversary of the distillery in 2019.
There is some confusion by many regarding Brora distillery, it was originally named Clynelish when production began. Its speciality is a heavily peated malt. A second distillery was built next door, to which is now called Cylnelish.
Some rebranding gave the original distillery the name Brora.
12 refill American oak hogsheads were used in this expression and only 1819 bottles were produced.

This lot contains 3 x 70cl bottlings:
Folio 1: The first edition from The Macallan Archival Series.  This 2015 distillery exclusive release is presented in a beautiful book shaped tin.  It was limited to less than 2000 bottles of 12 year old single malt with an ABV of 43%.  It comes with a hardback book that presents 80's Macallan advertisement pictures along with a USB stick of Macallan advertising archive. 70cl.
Folio 2:  The second edition from The Macallan Archival Series.  This distillery exclusive bottle was released in 2017 and was limited to 2000 bottles. This 12 year old single malt that had been matured in sherry casks and bottled at 43% ABV.  Presented in a book-shaped tin case and comes with a hardback book which revisits The Macallan's original print, press & film advertising campaign from 1980-1994.  The front image is a water-colour painted by artist Sara Midd. 70cl.
Folio 3: The third expression in the Archival Series from The Macallan, this distillery exclusive bottling was released in 2018, and limited to just 2,000 bottles. The bottle and book-shaped presentation tin showcase a campaign that celebrated the idea that whisky is best made in cold weather, with two people playing on the snow-covered slopes of Ben Rinnes. 43% ABV, 70cl.

This super premium bottling from Bowmore distillery was laid down in 1973 and bottled at the lovely age of 43 years!
The bottle was released in 2016 and was from the last 6 bourbon hogsheads of 1973.
A great bottle from an even better distillery.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Macallan - 30 Year Old Sherry Oak - 2018 Release
DESCRIPTION: This 2018 release from The Macallan is aged exclusively in Oloroso sherry seasoned casks from Jerez for all thirty years of its maturation. Resultingly, it is said to have a beautiful Oloroso sherry presence after this extended ageing.  It is a naturally dark, Speyside single malt full of rich dried fruits, spice and wood smoke.

This 2019 release from The Macallan is aged exclusively in Oloroso sherry seasoned casks from Jerez for all thirty years of its maturation. Resultingly, it is said to have a beautiful Oloroso sherry presence after this extended ageing. It is a naturally dark, Speyside single malt full of rich dried fruits, spice and wood smoke.

An absolutely stunning release from Hibiki. Hibiki is the flagship blend from Suntory & this bottle has become increasingly rare. 
It is a multi-award winning whisky - some international awards this whisky has won include:

This is a stunning single malt by Karuizawa Distillery. This bottling is part of a release by Karuizawa of 300 single casks which are quickly becoming increasingly rare.
This single cask bottling was distilled in 1981, matured in cask #6207 and was bottled on 5th September 2011 at the cask strength of 58.3% ABV.
It was selected and bottled by Number 1 Drinks Company Limited.

The annual release from the Macallan distillery comes this Easter Elchies 2013. Released in November and December 2013 with a large amount of anticipation. 
This 17-year-old, was distilled in 1996 and yielded 390 bottles.
390 bottles came from cask #26.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Macallan - 14 Year Old 2011 Easter Elchies + Mini
DESCRIPTION:
The 2011 Easter Elchies edition was distilled in 1997 and matured in Sherry butt casks before being bottled at 14 years old.  The bottle is presented with the purple bow and wax emblem. 
This bottle is popular with collectors as only 550 of these limited edition bottles were made available to visitors to the Macallan estate between November -December 2011.
This bottle 70cl bottle is accompanied by a 5cl miniature.

This 13-year-old single sherry butt was filled in 1999 and matured until 2012in cask #6697 which yielded 390 bottles.

One of 500 bottles by Suntory which was bottled in 2015.

Bottled for the Kinko Liquor Store.

The Macallan Genesis Limited Edition marks the creation of the iconic Distillery in a unique collaboration with internationally acclaimed architects Rogers Stirk Harbour + Partners.  Released in August 2018, the special edition bottling commemorates the unveiling of the brand new Macallan Distillery which opened in June 2018.
The bottle is presented in a beautiful gift box featuring a signed lithographic print of the Macallan Distillery and is said to be of such quality that it will never degrade, and will last as long as any unopened bottle!
One of 2500 bottles available exclusively from the Macallan Distillery and duty-free retail.

The Suntory Yamazaki Sherry Cask 2016 Edition is a no-age-statement single malt, it has been bottled at 48% ABV.  This was a limited release of only 5,000 bottles.
The 2013 Yamazaki Sherry Cask release was named World Whisky of the Year in Jim Murray's Whisky Bible 2015.

The Macallan Exceptional Cask 1990 is the fourth release in the Exceptional cask series. 
Fully matured in a sherry butt (24680) and distilled way back in December of 1990, this bottling was once descibed as "...this, unquestionably, is the greatest Macallan of them all."  
By whom you may ask? Think Whisky Bible 2014...

One of Islay's most iconic bottlings and most certainly one of Bowmore's. Both the bottle and the dragon depicted on the front are somewhat legends.
First seen in the 1990's  the liquid contained inside is from 1960's No.1 Vaults.

Only just released on 01 August 2019 from specialist retailers, this is the seventeenth release of The GlenDronach Cask Bottling programme - European Edition.
It includes a rich selection of the distillery’s signature Pedro Ximénez and Oloroso sherry casks from Andalucía in Spain, as well as two Port pipes from the Douro Valley in Portugal. Collectors can also find a rare cask from 1995, one of the last remaining casks at the distillery from this vintage. 
In total just fourteen casks dating from 1990 to 2007 were personally selected by Master Blender, Dr Rachel Barrie, specially chosen for their exceptional character, to celebrate and share some of the finest examples of The GlenDronach’s richly-sherried Highland Single Malt Scotch Whisky.
EUROPEAN ALLOCATED CASKS:7905, 221, 847, 5976, 325, 887, 6769
There are 7 further casks that have been allocated to APAC & Canada: 2623, 113, 5896, 416, 3040, 3343, 3359

The Glenlivet Cellar Collection was bottled at Cask Strength. It boasts a beautiful handwritten label and is one of only 1824 bottles.

2004 represents the 180th anniversary and all 15 casks used to make up this whisky were at their peak of maturity.

Five vintages of 20cl Glenlivets with the following years and ABV listed below.
1967 - 53.32%. (Rich with notes of deep sherried fruit)
1968 - 52.75%. (Full fragrance and gently sweet on the palate)
1969 - 52.20%. (Deep, nutty wood notes with a soft balanced richness)
1970 - 56.42%. (Dry, yet fruity, letting spicy sweetness show through)
1972 - 54.29%. (Spicy in the mouth with soft fragrant sweetness)
Even before George Smith got his license, his Glenlivet whisky was famous. Pack horses used to struggle across the remote Glen of Livet where no roads were there to help in order for thirsty aristocrats in Edinburgh would enjoy.

One of only 120 bottles.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Hanyu - 2000 Ichiro’s Malt 15 Year Old - The Final Vintage
DESCRIPTION:
A rare and exciting bottling of 15 year old Hanyu Japanese single malt whisky. It was distilled in 2000, aged for 15 years, and bottled at 46.5% ABV as part of the Ichiro's Malt range from stocks acquired by Ichiro Akuto after Hanyu closed down in 2000.
Only 3,710 bottle of this whisky was produced and it was aptly dubbed The Final Vintage of Hanyu.

The fourth edition in the Archival Series from The Macallan. Folio 4 remembers the legendary advertising campaigns of the 1970s, 1980s and 1990s that brought The Macallan to the public’s attention outside of Scotland.  It is presented in a beautiful book shaped, tin case. It features an advertisement including a Strathspey composed by James Scott Skinner (1843-1927). The advert notes that Skinner was so moved by his favourite malt he created a unique piece of music featuring his signature lilting notes with the simple catchphrase: “The Macallan. The Malt.”

Pappy Van Winkle has been is in serious demand of late.
This American Kentucky Straight Bourbon Whiskey is 15 years of age and took the place of "Old Rip Van Winkle" of the same age in 2004.
 
This is the 2018 bottling and the bottle code is -  L18134011036
This is a vintage bottle of Springbank's black labelled 15 Year Old, released in the 1980s. This is now a highly collectable bottling.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Balblair - 38 Year Old - 1966 Spanish Oak Cask
DESCRIPTION:
Distilled in a very famous year...when the government announced plans for decimalisation and of course England winning the football World Cup.
All 38 years were spent in a Spanish Oak cask before being bottled in 2004.
Scoring 9 out of 10 points on many occasions this whisky is one for the ages and now it is becoming a rare sight at auction.
 
This is bottle number 790.

The Rare Malts Selection is now-discontinued - but it was a series of cask-strength releases designed by Diageo to showcase some of the hidden treasures in their portfolio.
This Brora from the highlands is 20 years old and was distilled in 1982. Bottled at 58.1% this bottle has the added twist that the distillery is about to reopen in the coming years.

This is a very collectable bottling from Ardbeg, released in celebration of Fèis Ìle 2018. It was distilled in April 2005 and filled into an Oloroso sherry butt, where it aged until April 2018. This is one of just 543 individually numbered bottles released.

Titled as "Unblended Islay Malt Scotch Whisky" this beautiful 10 Year old is from the 1980's.
Tipped to be the most richly flavoured of all Scotch malt whiskies.
The screw-top is a dead give away for the age of the bottle combined with being 75cl having just converted from the old metril measurements.

Macallan Fine Oak 21 years old was matured in both bourbon and sherry cask. 
Whisky colour is measured using a device called a tint meter or a Tintometer. It will refer to the Lovibond colour scale which is of course brown.

Another beautiful release from the world-renowned “Ichiro’s Malt” range by Ichiro Akuto.
This blended malt is said to be a magnificently balanced blend, as with everything else from Ichiro, it is a whisky not to be missed.

This release is one of 690 bottles.

Jim McEwan's described this malt as "The precious legacy of those who went before us; a tribute to our past and a celebration of what is to come."
Well said Jim, well said.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Macallan - Rare Cask Black - Steven Klein
DESCRIPTION:
Released exclusively for travel retail, uniquely, Rare Cask Black has been crafted from first fill Spanish and American sherry seasoned oak casks from less than 100 casks.  This yielded 5,000 bottles of a more peated spirit.
This is the sixth release from the Macallan Masters of Photography range and adorns imagery created by Steven Klein, a US photographer whose clients have previously included the likes of Madonna, Lady Gaga and Britney Spears amidst many high profile fashion labels and magazines.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Game of Thrones - Limited Editions - 8 x 70cl + 1 x 1L (Import)
DESCRIPTION:
Game of Thrones series (8x 70cl) plus Johnnie Walker White Walker Game of Thrones edition (1L).  Note: duty stamp on any of set.
In celebration of the eighth and final season of the critically-acclaimed TV series, Game of Thrones, Diageo and HBO have released a limited-edition collection of single malt Scotch whiskies celebrating the show.
Each of the Game of Thrones Scotch whiskies has been paired with a particular house from the seven kingdoms in the television series, plus also the Night's Watch guard. 
Dalwhinnie Winter’s Frost - 43%: House StarkSingleton of Glendullan Select - 40%: House TullyCardhu Gold Reserve 40%: House TargaryenLagavulin 9 Year Old - 46%: House LannisterOban Bay Reserve - 43%: The Night’s WatchTalisker Select Reserve - 45.8%: House GreyjoyRoyal Lochnagar 12 Year Old - 40%: House BaratheonClynelish Reserve – 51.2%: House TyrelThis lot contains 8 x 70cl bottles - one of each listed above.

Douglas Laing's XOP (Xtra Old Particular) is the best of the best from the Douglas Laing family vaults. This particular expression from the Bowmore Distillery has spent 30 years maturing in Refill Butt #DL12376. It was bottled at the cask strength of 50.8%.  This is one of only 135 hand-filled bottles.
This is bottle number 076.

Yamazaki 18 Year Old is an award-winning Japanese single malt from Suntory Distillery.
This bottling earned Gold at the 2007 International Spirits Challenge, and impressively it also won double gold at the 2005 San Francisco World Spirits Competition.

This 12 year old Yamazaki is said to be multi-layered in taste and is highly praised by whisky connoisseurs.  It first came onto the scene in 1984 and was the first seriously marketed Japanese single malt whisky.  Yamazaki is arguably the number 1 single malt whisky in Japan and this would be a great contender for Suntory’s flagship single malt.

The 1841 Replica is the third is a series of replicas from Macallan which was released in 2003 following the 1861 and 1874 reproductions.
These antique-esque pieces from Macallan are to reflect on their past both in looks and in looks and in terms of recreating the whisky's nose and flavour.

This is bottle number 180 of 250.

A blend of famous whiskies released every year since 1984. Each bottle is numbered individually and signed by the master distiller Barry Crockett. 2012 was the year he decided to retire and to honour him they release Barry Crockett legacy. This whisky has been aged for a maximum of 25 years and a minimum of 12 years in Bourbon casks only.

A beautiful sherry cask from Glendronach aged 12 years.
This bottle is dated in the 1980's.
Very rare and becoming a great bottle for collectors.

Originally released for the Travel Retail market, this Glengoyne has been matured exclusively in first fill Oloroso sherry casks for 28 years. This Highland single malt was bottled at 46.8% ABV with no additional colouring.  It comes presented beautifully in a stylish, black presentation box.

This lot contains 8 x 70cl bottles - one of each listed above.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glenmorangie - 1990 Grand Vintage - Bond House Release No.1
DESCRIPTION: This is a stunningly presented first release in the Bond House No.1 series of vintage expressions.  This 1990 vintage single was matured in a combination of ex-bourbon and ex-Sherry casks for over 25 years and was bottled at 43% ABV in 2016.

This is a very elegant and clever presentation of Johnnie Walker.  This blended malt is made with three single malts married in European oak casks. The crystal decanter moves along with the motion of the ocean and its 'swing' design means it doesn't fall over.

Bottled in the highlands, this 20-year-old single malt from Clynelish was bottled to commemorate the distilleries 200th anniversary. In a beautifully presented box this cask strength malt was made only available from the distillery in 2019. It was matured in a combination of Bodega Sherry European Oak and Refill American oak casks to create a stunning expression.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Laphroaig - 19 Year Old - SMWS 29.260 Feis Ile 2019
DESCRIPTION:
Laphroaig, single cask, SMWS bottling.
'A visceral, elemental experience'
Matured in an Oloroso sherry butt for 19 years plus which was distilled 1999.
507 bottles were released for Feis Ile 2019.

This is a very elegant and clever presentation of Johnnie Walker.  This blended malt is made with three single malts married in European oak casks. The crystal decanter moves along with the motion of the ocean and its 'swing' design means it doesn't fall over.
This is an older style of bottling of the famous Macallan 10-year-old malt whisky. It comes presented in the all-white box showing Easter Elchies House,  which is increasingly hard to find.

The original bottle from this series was called Blacker Still. This is the second release, "Redder Still".
Bottled in 2007 after being matured in first-fill bourbon cask & finally finished in Chateau Lafleur Bordeaux.
Distilled in 2007 this is one of 2080 bottles worldwide.
Bottle number 652.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Game of Thrones - Limited Editions - 8 x 70cl
DESCRIPTION:
In celebration of the eighth and final season of the critically-acclaimed TV series, Game of Thrones, Diageo and HBO have released a limited-edition collection of single malt Scotch whiskies celebrating the show.
Each of the Game of Thrones Scotch whiskies has been paired with a particular house from the seven kingdoms in the television series, plus the Night’s Watch guard. 
This lot contains 8 x 70cl bottles - one of each listed above.

Campbeltown, for a long time, was the Whisky Capital of the World.
30 plus distilleries competed to be the king of Cambletown using locally sourced peat, barley and coal.
This private cask was matured for 25 years in a refill bourbon barrel.
With the resurgence in Springbanks popularity of late, this is certainly one to watch!

The Macallan 1851 Inspiration is the final piece in the replica puzzle.
This bottling is said to look identical to and is, as the name suggests, where it all began, distilling way back in 1851.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Ardbeg - 23 Year Old - Twenty Something (Committee Release)
DESCRIPTION: Released in late 2017, Ardbeg Twenty Something is 23 year old single malt matured in ex-Bourbon and ex-Oloroso Sherry casks. This is a limited edition committee bottling elected by Dr Bill Lumsden, Director of Distilling, Whisky Creation & Whisky Stocks at Ardbeg. He has created a non-chill filtered whisky that’s been bottled at 46.3% ABV.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Ardbeg - 23 Year Old - Twenty Something (Committee Release)
DESCRIPTION: Released in late 2017, Ardbeg Twenty Something is 23 year old single malt matured in ex-Bourbon and ex-Oloroso Sherry casks. This is a limited edition committee bottling elected by Dr Bill Lumsden, Director of Distilling, Whisky Creation & Whisky Stocks at Ardbeg. He has created a non-chill filtered whisky that’s been bottled at 46.3% ABV.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Ardbeg - 23 Year Old - Twenty Something (Committee Release)
DESCRIPTION: Released in late 2017, Ardbeg Twenty Something is 23 year old single malt matured in ex-Bourbon and ex-Oloroso Sherry casks. This is a limited edition committee bottling elected by Dr Bill Lumsden, Director of Distilling, Whisky Creation & Whisky Stocks at Ardbeg. He has created a non-chill filtered whisky that’s been bottled at 46.3% ABV.

Distilled in 1978 and matured for 30 years in Spanish Oloroso sherry butts.  The expression was part of the distillery’s Vintage Range released in 2009. This was a limited release of only 3000 bottles. It comes in a stunning presentation case.

Non chill filtered and bottled at natural colour after 26 years of maturation. 
Bottled in April 2011 and distilled in October 1982
Cask 2219 yielded 348 bottles from the beautiful, now closed, lowland distillery.

An 11 year old Lagavulin chosen by distillery manager Georgette Crawford, bottled in December 2013.
The Manager’s Dram series of whiskies were bottled exclusively for employees of what is now known as Diageo.  These whiskies were selected by the respective distillery managers within Diageo malt distilling and bottled at natural cask strength.

This is a very limited independent bottling from the Speyside distillery, Tomintoul.  This single malt was distilled in 1967 and matured in ex-bourbon wood.  It was bottled at 41.5% for Liquid Sun in Germany in 2011. 
This is one of only 156 bottles produced.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bowmore - 24 Year Old - 2019 Hand Fill - Sherry Cask #1558
DESCRIPTION:
This is a stunning single cask handfill from Bowmore Distillery. This is one of the oldest distillery exclusive single casks to be released to date.
It was distilled in July 1995 and matured in sherry cask #1558 for 24 years until September 2019 when it was bottled at 48.8% abv.
 
This is bottle number 351.

A world-famous Japanese blend, made with specially aged malt and grain whiskies from Suntory's distilleries. This popular blend was matured in mizunara casks for over seventeen years and has been awarded an "Editor's Choice" from Whisky Magazine.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Littlemill - 21 Year Old (First Release) Limited Edition
DESCRIPTION:
Littlemill is a lost Lowland distillery that was closed in 1994. However, stock from the distillery still exists, and this striking 21 year old is an official bottling as the Littlemill name and license are still owned by Loch Lomond distillery. This is a limited release of 1000 individually numbered bottles.
This is bottle number 45.

The Macallan Fine Oak 17 Years Old is part of the Macallan Fine Oak range.  It has been matured for a minimum of seventeen years in three oak cask types including American and European ex-oloroso sherry and American oak bourbon casks. It was introduced to the US market in 2006.

A world-famous Japanese blend, made with specially aged malt and grain whiskies from Suntory's distilleries. This popular blend was matured in mizunara casks for over seventeen years and has been awarded an "Editor's Choice" from Whisky Magazine.

Bottled at 50.7% this beautiful bottle is a great example of what the Island distillery is all about.
The most Northernmost Scotch distillery in the world.

A hard to find 7 Year Old Armando Giovinetti Special Selection from the 1990s. This bottling was specially produced for Giovinetti and Figli, the Italian wine and spirits company.
Armando Giovinetti, famous among the whisky community, has often been known as the main link between Scotland and Itlay long-lasting history when it comes to single malts.
Sara Midda artistic flair has been used on the label and was painted during a visit to the distillery. Both people related to the distillery at this time.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bruichladdich - 19 Year Old (1989)  - Black Art - First Edition
DESCRIPTION: This limited-edition of just 6,000 bottles worldwide was the first edition of the legendary Bruichladdich Black Art. Former Master Distiller Jim McEwan has kept the composition of this whisky as enigmatic as ever.  Distilled in 1989, the composition of the casks is a mystery to everyone but the creator himself, matured in bourbon and a medley of wine casks and bottled 19 long years later in the true Bruichladdich artisan style.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: GlenDronach - 1992 - 26 Year Old Singled Cask #64 (The Whisky Shop Exclusive)
DESCRIPTION:
This GlenDronach 26 year old was bottled exclusively for The Whisky Shop in 2018.  This is one of 493 individually numbered bottles, which is part of GlenDronach's extensive and ever-popular single cask series.  This single malt was distilled in 1992, matured in a sherry cask for 26 years and was bottled at 57.1% ABV. 
This is bottle number 485.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bowmore - 24 Year Old - 2019 Hand Fill - Sherry Cask #1558
DESCRIPTION:
This is a stunning single cask handfill from Bowmore Distillery. This is one of the oldest distillery exclusive single casks to be released to date.
It was distilled in July 1995 and matured in sherry cask #1558 for 24 years until September 2019 when it was bottled at 48.8% abv.
 
This is bottle number 352.

The "Still" series goes on...
Golder Still, 23 years old, from Bruichladdich was a bit of an experiment having been matured in casks made by American cooperages in the 80s.
There is science in the madness in that the smaller Bourbon casks will give additional contact with the wood. 
This is bottle number 1972 of 4866.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bowmore - 27 Years Old - Vintner's Trilogy III (Port Cask)
DESCRIPTION: This is the third release in Bowmore's Vintner's Trilogy - each released with different wine finish. This 27-year-old was double matured; for the first 13 years, it was aged in bourbon barrels, then aged for the remaining years in Port Pipes.  The lengthy port pipe finish has produced hints of sweet, spice, salt and peat smoke.

Released in 2017, Suntory’s limited edition Yamazaki is a blend of various cask-matured Yamazaki vintages and a credit to Suntory’s chief Master Blender Shinji Fukuyo.  The single malt comprises of vintages of up to 20 years old, including whiskies matured in bourbon, sherry, and European oak casks.

Specially selected for Nolan Fine Spirits this Springbank 25 Year Old is a lovely independent bottling.
For years Campbeltown was considered the biggest whisky-producing area in the world!
This bottle came from cask number 1992 No 242.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 30 Year Old - Old Malt Cask
DESCRIPTION:
Douglas Laing line of Old Malt cask here with a lovely, well-aged, bottle of Highland Park.
It was distilled in March 1978 before being bottled at 30 years of age in March 2008.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Ardbeg - 22 Year Old - Twenty Something - Committee Release
DESCRIPTION:
The 2018 edition of the Twenty Something releases, the third bottled exclusively for the Ardbeg Committee, the distillery's fan club.
This 22 year old was distilled in 1996, when the distillery was under the threat of demolition.  It was one of the last distillations in Ardbeg’s old equipment – these stills now sit monumentally outside the distillery gates.  The single malt was matured in ex-bourbon barrels from of some of the most limited stock in any Scottish distillery warehouse.
A highly collectible series of decanters produced by John Tongue in 1984 for Royal Doulton and Whyte & Mackay.  This lot includes:
Hakushu 18 Year Old is part of the Suntory group. Not many people know, but at the time of writing this descrpition, Bowmore is part of this conglomerate.

The Macallan 12 Year Old was exclusively matured in selected sherry oak casks from Jerez, Spain.
This 12 year old was a late addition by Macallan before the age statement range was discontinued in 2013 - This bottle is now hard to find in the UK.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bowmore - 24 Year Old - 2019 Hand Fill - Sherry Cask #1558
DESCRIPTION:
This is a stunning single cask handfill from Bowmore Distillery. This is one of the oldest distillery exclusive single casks to be released to date.
It was distilled in July 1995 and matured in sherry cask #1558 for 24 years until September 2019 when it was bottled at 48.8% abv.
 
This is bottle number 163.

Titled as "Unblended Islay Malt Scotch Whisky" this beautiful 10 Year old is from the 1980's.
Tipped to be the most richly flavoured of all Scotch malt whiskies.
The screw-top is a dead give away for the age of the bottle combined with being 75cl having just converted from the old metril measurements.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bowmore - 24 Year Old - 2019 Hand Fill - Sherry Cask #1558
DESCRIPTION:
This is a stunning single cask handfill from Bowmore Distillery. This is one of the oldest distillery exclusive single casks to be released to date.
It was distilled in July 1995 and matured in sherry cask #1558 for 24 years until September 2019 when it was bottled at 48.8% abv. 
Bottle Number 480.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bowmore - 24 Year Old - 2019 Hand Fill - Sherry Cask #1558
DESCRIPTION:
This is a stunning single cask handfill from Bowmore Distillery. This is one of the oldest distillery exclusive single casks to be released to date.
It was distilled in July 1995 and matured in sherry cask #1558 for 24 years until September 2019 when it was bottled at 48.8% abv. 
This item comes with a keyring. Bottle number 482.
This is an old-style presentation of Macallan 10 Year old was bottled in the 1990s. This classic Speyside malt whisky matured in sherry oak casks from Jerez. Very collectable.

A lovely old-style bottle of Caol Ila 12.
You would usually find this bottle being exported, however, this is one of the originals that stayed on home soil.
Caol Ila is currently undergoing mass reconstruction and should be ready in 2020.
 
Please note there is no box with this lot.

At 131ppm The inaugural release of Bruichladdich's Octomore.
At this time, in 2008, it held the record for the most heavily peated spirit across the globe.
Distilled in October 2002 and matured for 5 years before bottling in April 2008, this bottle is one of only 6,000 bottles.
Collectors...take note!

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glen Flagler - 8 Year Old All Malt
DESCRIPTION:
Glen Flagler is an 8 Year Old malt that was distilled in the 1980s. Owned by Inverhouse distillers, comes this "Rare All-Malt Scotch". Due to the short history of this distillery, records make it hard to put an exact date on then the whisky was produced.
Now closed, bottlings of this kind are becoming increasingly rare.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Benriach - 31 Year Old - Virgin American Oak
DESCRIPTION:
Distilled in 1977 in a Virgin American Oak Cask in the heart of Speyside. Bottled at cask strength it has tasting characteristics of vanilla dn almonds combined with crème brulèe.
Established in 1898 and built by John Duff the distillery still has well over 20000 casks maturing in their natural environment.
Bottle number 205 of 292.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glendronach - 26 Year Old - 1990 Single PX Cask #2973
DESCRIPTION:
Distilled in June 1990 and bottled in September 2016 this release is part of batch #14 of the Glendronach single cask series.  It was matured a single Pedro Ximenez Sherry Puncheon #2973 for 26 years.  This is one of 584 individually numbered bottles.
This is bottle number 551.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Johnnie Walker - Blue Label - Madrid & Barcelona
DESCRIPTION:
A twin pack of Johnnie Walker Blue label including Barcelona and Madrid Limited Editions.
Both designs feature unique detailing on the box of the cities.

The Chairman's Release is considered the flagship of Macallan's 1700 series. The series takes its name from the year that Easter Elchies House, the home of The Macallan, was built.
Bottled in 2001, The Chairman's Release single malt is held in an elegant flint gicel glass bottle.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bowmore - 17 Year Old  - 1999 Hand Filled PX Cask #24 - Fèis Ìle 2016
DESCRIPTION:
This single cask handfill is one of three releases by Bowmore for the Fèis Ìle 2016.
It was distilled in January 1999 and matured in a single Pedro Ximenez European oak cask #24. 
This is bottle number 75.

'Loki' is the second part of Highland Park's Valhalla collection.  It was released in 2013. 
Loki is Thor's adoptive brother and known as the trickster - Highland Park have tried to match this 15 year old single malt to his personality.  It comes with a striking display stand and is one of 21,000 bottles produced.

The Rare Malts Selection is now-discontinued - but it was a series of cask-strength releases designed by Diageo to showcase some of the hidden treasures in their portfolio.
Founded in 1817 by Captain Hugh Munro, this was one of Ross-shire first legal distilleries. The stills draw pure water from the Dairywell spring.
This is bottle number 2996.

Featuring exclusive artwork by Koralie this Highland Park was distilled in 1989 and forms part of the Artist Collection.
25 Years were spent in a single hogshead number 10526 to form this expression. Only 240 bottles have been produced.

One of 1000 bottles produced from India. This expression was matured in 6 different casks. It spent the first 3 years of its maturation period in ex-bourbon barrels. After which it was moved onto -
Ex-Oloroso Sherry
New French Oak
New American Oak
New Spanish Oak
Ex-Pedro Ximenez Sherry

Only released to the Taiwanese & Japanese market the Macallan 12 Year Old Gran Reserva was matured in first-fill Olorosa casks.
Its hard to find nature reflects in its collectable value.
Nose - Waves of burnished Oak, with rich dried fruits.
Palate - Intense spiced ginger and Oak
Finish - Lingering wood spice. ginger and clove.
This Speymalt series by Gordon & Macphail is from The Macallan Distillery. It was distilled in 1999 and bottled in 2000.

Highland Park 'Ragnvald' is said to be one of the more deluxe expressions from Highland Park's Warriors series.  The Ragnvald was made using whiskies primarily from European oak casks and some American oak casks. The name comes from a Viking well known for his sailing and acquiring of valuable trinkets, like spices, fabrics and jewels. 
No outer carton only wooden box.
This is an old-style presentation of Macallan 10 Year old was bottled in the 1990s. This classic Speyside malt whisky matured in sherry oak casks from Jerez. Very collectable.
This is an old-style presentation of Macallan 10 Year old was bottled in the 1990s. This classic Speyside malt whisky matured in sherry oak casks from Jerez. Very collectable.

Only released to the Taiwanese & Japanese market the Macallan 12 Year Old Gran Reserva was matured in first-fill Olorosa casks.
Its hard to find nature reflects in its collectable value.
Nose - Waves of burnished Oak, with rich dried fruits.
Palate - Intense spiced ginger and Oak
Finish - Lingering wood spice. ginger and clove.

This stunning Bruichladdich is a 25 year old single malt distilled in 1990, which gives it its name.  It was released exclusively for the travel retail market in 2017.
Bruichladdich in Sherry casks has always been unusual but this single malt was produced as part of their long-standing collaboration with winemaker Jan Pettersen.  It comes from two distinct batches of Islay whisky; refill Sherry butts from Jerez and casks that had previously held American bourbon.

This Bowmore was matured solely in a Port Cask and if you ask us, it gives a sherry cask a run for its money!
16 years later it was bottled and at cask strength.53.1%.

This is a popular and much sought-after single malt with the massive peat-smoke that's typical of southern Islay - but also offering richness and a dryness that turns it into a truly interesting tipple. The 16 year old, aged in oak casks has truly become a benchmark Islay dram from the Lagavulin distillery.
This whisky was The Runner Up in TWE's Whisky of the Year 2014 & 2015 Silver Outstanding Medal Winner - International Wine & Spirits Competition amongst other accolades. 
White Horse Edition is very appealing to collectors and is fast disappearing.

This is the 2019 Macallan Boutique release.
Taken from a few different matured casks this beautiful dram has notes of sweet dried fruits, ginger and Oak spices. Created for the boutiques only.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glen Ord - 23 Year Old - Rare Malts
DESCRIPTION:
The Rare Malts Selection is now-discontinued - but it was a series of cask-strength releases designed by Diageo to showcase some of the hidden treasures in their portfolio.
Glen Ord was founded in 1838 on Clan Mackenzie land at Muir of Ord.
With a peaty nose and full-body, a lovely dram and still very rare at auction.
 
This is bottle number 2276.

This is the 2019 Macallan Boutique release.
Taken from a few different matured casks this beautiful dram has notes of sweet dried fruits, ginger and Oak spices. Created for the boutiques only.
Johnnie walker Premier was blended from some very rare whiskies in the Johnnie Walker inventory. A selection of the whisky included in this blend is from closed distilleries. This is a 75cl bottling.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bruichladdich - Octomore - Event Hoizon - Fèis Ìle 2019
DESCRIPTION:
Octomore Event Horizon is the 2019 Fèis Ìle expression from Bruichladdich.  It is the oldest Octomore released by the Islay distillery.  This is one of only 2,000 bottles of Octomore Event Horizon which were released exclusively at the distillery during the festival and have already sold out completely.
Octomore is a heavily-peated whisky produced at Bruichladdich. The Octomore Event Horizon, however, is made from malted barley peated to 162.6ppm, half the level of the distillery’s peatiest release.  The whisky was distilled in 2007 and has been matured for 12 years in ex-oloroso and ex-Pedro Ximénez Sherry casks from Fernando de Castilla in Jerez.
Bottled without chill filtration or colouring at 55.7% abv, the whisky is said to contain notes of ‘huge smoke, dried fruit notes and an earthy, rounded presence on the palate’.

Murray Mcdavid brought this distillery back to life in 2000 after it was closed by Whyte and Mackay. Jim McEwan has been instrumental in building this brand up from the ground. He has been hugely successful in his extrovert ideas with regards to cask management, quirky bottle colours, heavily HEAVILY peated malts and now they are even making Gin too!
The story behind this bottle is that one day a fisherman came across a small yellow submarine. The ministry of defence denied any connection with it of course and so did the Beatles...

Murray Mcdavid brought this distillery back to life in 2000 after it was closed by Whyte and Mackay. Jim McEwan has been instrumental in building this brand up from the ground. He has been hugely successful in his extrovert ideas with regards to cask management, quirky bottle colours, heavily HEAVILY peated malts and now they are even making Gin too!
The story behind this bottle is that one day a fisherman came across a small yellow submarine. The ministry of defence denied any connection with it of course and so did the Beatles...

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Millburn - 25 Year Old - Rare Malt Selection
DESCRIPTION:
Rare Malt Selection could be considered as one of the most sought after 3rd party whisky bottlers. They have a large selection of malts from both operational and lost distilleries.
This Highland Malt is a great example of what the company represents.
Distilled in 1975 before being bottled in October 2001 at its natural cask strength of 61.9% ABV.
This is bottle number 4409.

This is the 2019 Macallan Boutique release.
Taken from a few different matured casks this beautiful dram has notes of sweet dried fruits, ginger and Oak spices. Created for the boutiques only.

This is the 2019 Macallan Boutique release.
Taken from a few different matured casks this beautiful dram has notes of sweet dried fruits, ginger and Oak spices. Created for the boutiques only.

This is the 2019 Macallan Boutique release.
Taken from a few different matured casks this beautiful dram has notes of sweet dried fruits, ginger and Oak spices. Created for the boutiques only.

This 25 year old from Bunnahabhain distillery is a sherried, only lightly peated dram that is part of a limited release of just 400 bottles. It was also Bunnahabhains second release of unchilled-filtered, natural colour, single malts.

This is a popular and much sought-after single malt with the massive peat-smoke that's typical of southern Islay - but also offering richness and a dryness that turns it into a truly interesting tipple. The 16 year old, aged in oak casks has truly become a benchmark Islay dram from the Lagavulin distillery.
This whisky was The Runner Up in TWE's Whisky of the Year 2014 & 2015 Silver Outstanding Medal Winner - International Wine & Spirits Competition amongst other accolades. 
White Horse Edition is very appealing to collectors and is fast disappearing.

A 2002 vintage bottled for Frank McGuire. Free of colouring and non-chill-filtered this bottle is very, very rare.
Only 24 bottles were released of this malt which came from cask number 443.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bowmore - 15 Year Old - Laimrig - Fèis Ìle 2011
DESCRIPTION:
A 15-Year-Old Bowmore was released for the Fèis Ìle 2011 matured exclusively in sherry butts and bottled at cask strength of 54.8%. This is one of just 500 bottles produced.  The bottling has been named 'Laimrig' which is Gaelic for 'Pier' and the bottling celebrates Bowmore's stone pier.
 
This is bottle number 479.
A long discontinued bottle from the Orkney distillery. We estimate this bottle to be from the late 1980s.
Miyagikyo 15 Year Old produced by Nikka is now discontinued. Miyagikyo distillery produces a refined malt whisky with a signature fruity and floral freshness.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bowmore - 20 Year Old - 2019 Hand Fill - PX Cask
DESCRIPTION:
This Bowmore hand fill comes from the legendary No.1 Vaults on Islay after being held in a 1st fill PX Sherry Cask for 20 years!
Arguably one of the nicest bottles to come from the distillery this year so far and the fact it can only be bought from the Island it makes it even rarer.
Distillation Date - 20/1/99
This is bottle number 9

Excluisvley released to Ardbeg Committee members in September 2019, this is the fifth and latest release of the Ardbeg Supernova.  Matured in ex-Bourbon casks, this limited edition, non-age- statement release is described as having aromas of ‘pungent aniseed, menthol and eucalyptus’, with a ‘nebula of bonfires, soot, charred oak, birch tar and menthol’ on the palate.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bowmore - 20 Year Old - 2019 Hand Fill - PX Cask
DESCRIPTION:
This Bowmore hand fill comes from the legendary No.1 Vaults on Islay after being held in a 1st fill PX Sherry Cask for 20 years!
Arguably one of the nicest bottles to come from the distillery this year so far and the fact it can only be bought from the Island it makes it even rarer.
Distillation Date - 20/1/99
Bottle number 33.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bowmore - 20 Year Old - 2019 Hand Fill - PX Cask
DESCRIPTION:
This Bowmore hand fill comes from the legendary No.1 Vaults on Islay after being held in a 1st fill PX Sherry Cask for 20 years!
Arguably one of the nicest bottles to come from the distillery this year so far and the fact it can only be bought from the Island it makes it even rarer.
Distillation Date - 20/1/99
Bottle number 34.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bowmore - 20 Year Old - 2019 Hand Fill - PX Cask
DESCRIPTION:
This Bowmore hand fill comes from the legendary No.1 Vaults on Islay after being held in a 1st fill PX Sherry Cask for 20 years!
Arguably one of the nicest bottles to come from the distillery this year so far and the fact it can only be bought from the Island it makes it even rarer.
Distillation Date - 20/1/99
This is bottle number 35.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Caol Ila - 25 Year Old - Cask Strength (2007 Beach Rugby)
DESCRIPTION:
Given to players who took part in the 2007 Lagavulin Beach Rugby tournament on White HEart Beach Port Ellen, Islay.
It celebrated 25 years of the tournament and is bottled at cask strength (59.4%).
A mixture of both American and European Oak refill casks to give a firm, fresh and smooth-bodied taste.
This bottle has been SIGNED by the distillery manager at the time!

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Tamdhu - 2002 Single Cask #6191 - Edinburgh Airport - Signed by Sandy McIntyre
DESCRIPTION:
597 bottles were released on the 2nd March 2019 in the World Duty Free store at Edinburgh Airport.
Distilled in November 2002 and bottled in February 2019, this first-fill Oloroso sherry cask from Jerez, was hand-picked by key members of the Dufry and Edinburgh Airport teams in November 2018 during a visit to the Tamdhu Distillery. Officially the oldest ever single cask released from Tamdhu.
The front of the box has been signed by Sandy MacIntyre.

This annual release of The Macallan's popular 18 Year Old Sherry Oak is matured exclusively in sherry seasoned casks, built from both Spanish and American oak, providing a beautifully dark flavour with rich aromas.
The nose opens with dried fruits, ginger and hints of citrus with vanilla and cinnamon. The palate is rich in dried fruits, spices, orange, cloves and wood smoke, before a full and lingering finish with sweet toffee, ginger and a hint of smoke.
This beautiful, classic styled 21 year old decanter from Glenfiddich, released to celebrate a century of distillations at the distillery, presented in a Wedgwood decanter.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 11 Year Old - The Battle of Jutland
DESCRIPTION: This expression was distilled in 2004, and matured in a refill puncheon cask #3378 for 11 years.  582 bottles were produced to commemorate the largest naval battle of WW1 fought between British and German naval forces with much of the British fleet dispatched from Orkney’s Scapa Flow bay.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Singleton Of Glen Ord - 16 Year Old - The Managers Dram 2016
DESCRIPTION: A 16-year-old Single malt from Glen Ord, specially selected by malt distillery managers within Diageo Distillery Ltd and bottled at natural cask strength. 2016 Edition.

Mannochmore 2018 Managers dram is highly sought after for most collectors as the series goes on, year on year.
Bottled at its natural strength 58% this was specially selected by Annelise Hastings.
This is bottle number 704

Excluisvley released to Ardbeg Committee members in September 2019, this is the fifth and latest release of the Ardbeg Supernova.  Matured in ex-Bourbon casks, this limited edition, non-age- statement release is described as having aromas of ‘pungent aniseed, menthol and eucalyptus’, with a ‘nebula of bonfires, soot, charred oak, birch tar and menthol’ on the palate.

Octomore Farm - Islay Single Malt Scotch Whisky.
This 7-year-old single malt from a bourbon cask was distilled in 2009 and bottled in 2016.
One of the rarest bottles from the series and very difficult to find.  It was a special bottling for J Brown.

The Macallan Fine Oak 17 Years Old is part of the Macallan Fine Oak range.  It has been matured for a minimum of seventeen years in three oak cask types including American and European ex-oloroso sherry and American oak bourbon casks. It was introduced to the US market in 2006.

Ardbeg Supernova SN2015 is the final release of a 4 part series.
The story of this bottle is quite incredible, Ardbeg successfully launched whisky into space and believe it or not...it returned.
At over 100 PPM peated you could certainly say this whisky hits the pallet with a big bang!
This lot also comes with a 5cl miniature Ardbeg Supernova SN2015.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - Viking Soul Cask - 59 Degrees N
DESCRIPTION:
A firkin cask yielded 58 bottles of this 12 1/2 year old spirit from the Northernmost Scotch Whisky distillery in Scotland.
The cask number is 500144 and if you are lucky enough to win this bottle you are one of only a handful of people in the world to have a personal batch of HP.
Master Whisky Maker Gordon Morton hand-selected each cask from this series and said, "Each cask is unique, you will find you own personal tasting notes, thats your cask DNA"
Welcome to the Highland Park tribe!
Bottle number 58 of 58...which is kind of special we think.
A long discontinued bottle from the Orkney distillery. We estimate this bottle to be from the late 1980s.
Johnnie walker Premier was blended from some very rare whiskies in the Johnnie Walker inventory. A selection of the whisky included in this blend is from closed distilleries. This is a 75cl bottling.

This 41 year old limited edition blended malt is produced by North Star Spirits.
The magic behind this bottle began in November 1976 when the whiskies used in this expression were distilled.
Bottled in 2008 it is one of 400 bottles which were bottled at cask strength.

The Macallan Estate Reserve 2019 forms part of The 1824 Collection. It is a classic style of Macallan that includes a parcel of specially selected casks to deliver great richness and intensity.
All of the whisky used was grown locally on the Macallan estate.  The whisky is distilled just once a year, over the course of a single week. The single malt was then matured exclusively in sherry seasoned butts and hogsheads.

This now-discontinued Hibiki 12 year old is a superb blended Japanese whisky meaning it has become a very popular, rare and collectable bottling. Hibiki includes malt whisky from Yamazaki and Hakushu, as well as grain whisky from Chita. The whisky is partly matured in plum liqueur barrels.  Unfortunately, Hibiki 12 was discontinued by Suntory in 2015.

Donny's Chocolate Drops for the Machrie Team Challange Winners.
An Islay private bottling from Bruichladdich which was distilled in 2002 and matured for 6 years in cask 1255. 
There were only 41 bottles produced and it was bottled on the 18th of Feb 2009. Free of colour and non chill-filtered. 
This is bottle number 38 of 41.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bunnahabhain - 12 Year Old - Port Wood Finish - Fèis Ìle 2005
DESCRIPTION:
This is one of just 766 bottles of 12-Year-Old Port Wood Finish from cask #1 - distilled, matured and bottled by Bunnahabhain.  It was released for Fèis Ìle 2005.
The tube features the signature distillery manager J MacLellan and a distillery worker.

This stunning bottle is the fourth and final part of Highland Park's Valhalla collection that follows on from Thor, Loki and Freya.
'The Furious One' has been described as a rich and dark whisky with the distillery's trademark sweet and gently peaty character.  
It has been aged for 16 years in a combination of first fill sherry and refill hogshead casks.  This is one of 17,000 bottles produced.

This now-discontinued Hibiki 12 year old is a superb blended Japanese whisky meaning it has become a very popular, rare and collectable bottling. Hibiki includes malt whisky from Yamazaki and Hakushu, as well as grain whisky from Chita. The whisky is partly matured in plum liqueur barrels.  Unfortunately, Hibiki 12 was discontinued by Suntory in 2015.

This is a popular and much sought-after single malt with the massive peat-smoke that's typical of southern Islay - but also offering richness and a dryness that turns it into a truly interesting tipple. The 16 year old, aged in oak casks has truly become a benchmark Islay dram from the Lagavulin distillery.
This whisky was The Runner Up in TWE's Whisky of the Year 2014 & 2015 Silver Outstanding Medal Winner - International Wine & Spirits Competition amongst other accolades. 
White Horse Edition is very appealing to collectors and is fast disappearing.

This 22 Year Old Mortlach was matured in Sherry butt #5159.  Distilled in August 1990 and bottled in February 2013, it was then bottled for the Chieftain's range by Ian Macleod, with 654 bottles produced.

This is a natural cask strength bottling of the medicinal 10 year old from Islay's bestselling distillery, Laphroaig.  In making Laphroaig, malted barley is dried over a peat fire.  The smoke from this peat, found only on Islay, gives Laphroaig its particularly rich flavour. This release was bottled at 55.7% straight from the wood.

This now-discontinued Hibiki 12 year old is a superb blended Japanese whisky meaning it has become a very popular, rare and collectable bottling. Hibiki includes malt whisky from Yamazaki and Hakushu, as well as grain whisky from Chita. The whisky is partly matured in plum liqueur barrels.  Unfortunately, Hibiki 12 was discontinued by Suntory in 2015.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Caol Ila - 22 Year Old - Fèis Ìle 2019
DESCRIPTION:
This 22-year-old single malt was released by Caol Ila Distillery as their Fèis Ìle 2019 bottling.  It has been fully matured in Sherry-treated American oak hogsheads and bottled at a cask strength of 58.4% abv. The whisky is said to contain ‘fresh mint, citrus, spicy medicinal notes finished with a dominant note of spice’ on the palate.
This is one of 3000 individually numbered bottles.
This is bottle number 16.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Royal Lochnagar - 12 Year Old - Manager's Dram 2017
DESCRIPTION:
The 2017 Manager's dram was from Royal Lochnagar and 12 Years Old.
Sean Phillips, the distillery manager t the time chose this bottling in November 2017.

Blowing your socks off at a nice little cask strength of 55.7% this Islay malt is 10 years old.
Bottled straight from the wood the rich flavours come through like never before.

One of only 1000 bottles the Bimber Inaugural release was handcrafted and aged in Ex Pedro Ximenez Sherry Casks.
5 casks were used to make the Polish creators first malt - number 6,19,31,37 and 38.
After imigrating from Poland, the founder Dariusz Plazewski pursued his passion for distilling. We must say, we are very glad he did!
Huge congrats to all that were involved in this special release. Only 800 bottles were released to the UK market and the other 200 were avalable internationally.
This is bottle number 171 of 1000.

The third release in the Macallan Edition series.  A unique selection of oak cask styles are combined to yield a new limited edition expression each year.  
Edition No.3 was a collaboration between master perfumer Roja Dove and master whisky maker Bob Dalgarno.  With Dove's remarkable sensory knowledge, Dalgarno shaped the character of Edition No.3 from a combination of European and American oak casks to create a deliciously sweet, single malt with floral notes.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bruichladdich - 21 Year Old - Black Art - Edition 2.2
DESCRIPTION:
This is the second release from Bruichladdich in the Black Art Series and it is just as mysterious as the first release.  Distilled in 1989, this 21 Year Old is labelled Edition 2.2.
American and European Oak wines casks were used in this lovely bottling. An expression in the Black Art series is now released annually as part of the core range.

The 'On The Way' series by Chichibu charts the fledgeling distillery's progress over the years.  This is the 2015 release of Chichibu On The Way.  It is a multi-vintage vatting of whisky distilled from when they opened in 2008, including some of their oldest whiskies which has been matured in bourbon casks then finished in Mizunara casks.  This bottling is already very popular with Japanese whisky enthusiasts as it showcases the skill of distiller Ichiro Akuto and his team.
This is bottle number 9320.

The 'On The Way' series by Chichibu charts the fledgeling distillery's progress over the years.  This is the 2015 release of Chichibu On The Way.  It is a multi-vintage vatting of whisky distilled from when they opened in 2008, including some of their oldest whiskies which has been matured in bourbon casks then finished in Mizunara casks.  This bottling is already very popular with Japanese whisky enthusiasts as it showcases the skill of distiller Ichiro Akuto and his team.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 12 Year Old - Viking Soul Cask #500144 - 59 Degrees N
DESCRIPTION:
This edition is part of the Viking Soul Cask Releases, bottled exclusively for 59 Degrees N. This malt was vatted at 57% in Firkins and Quarter Casks for a fixed final period of maturation, resulting in a richer and more intense flavour. This is a 12.5 year old from #500144, bottled in 2019. This is one of only 58 bottles.
The opportunity to own a Viking Soul Cask is only available to members of Highland Parks Inner Circle.

The 'On The Way' series by Chichibu charts the fledgeling distillery's progress over the years.  This is the 2015 release of Chichibu On The Way.  It is a multi-vintage vatting of whisky distilled from when they opened in 2008, including some of their oldest whiskies which has been matured in bourbon casks then finished in Mizunara casks.  This bottling is already very popular with Japanese whisky enthusiasts as it showcases the skill of distiller Ichiro Akuto and his team.
This is bottle number 10,286.

Bottled for the celebration of the Queen's Golden Jubilee, it was taken from the cask after 25 years in 1977.
Shaped like a still, this beautiful decanted was filled on the banks of the Spey and taken to an exhibition to celebrate at Hyde Park.
Want to own a part of history and be like a royal? This could be for you...
This is bottle number 516.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Chichibu - Ichiro's Malt - The Peated 2011 - Cask Strength
DESCRIPTION:
This was a limited release of 5,980 bottles and is heavily peated malt which was distilled in 2011 and bottled 2015 at the cask strength of 62.5%. This is one of 5980 individually numbered bottles.
In 2007, Ichiro Akuto, the grandson of the founder of the Hanyu Distillery, started a new chapter in Japans whisky industry by building Chichibu distillery. Some of the equipment includes a small mill, mash tun and washback made of Japanese Oak.
This is bottle number 5006.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Woodford Reserve -  Master's Collection - Batch Proof (2018 Edition)
DESCRIPTION: This is small-batch Kentucky bourbon is produced by Labrot & Graham.  It is said to be the fastest-growing bourbon in the U.S. and is the Official Bourbon of the Kentucky Derby.  This bottle is part of Woodford Reserve's Master's Collection range and this Batch Proof bottling shows off the same mashbill as the classic Woodford Reserve Kentucky Bourbon.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: North Port - Signatory Vintage 24 Year Old 1975
DESCRIPTION:
North Port distillery laid this cask down June 1975 and it is one of 620 bottles.
It was bottled by Signatory at its natural colour. from a sherry refill cask.
This is bottle number 195.

The whisky is partly matured in plum liqueur barrels.  Unfortunately, Hibiki 12 was discontinued by Suntory in 2015.

A 23-year-old Glendronach and the UK exclusive this single malt was matured in an Oloroso Sherry butt.
Bottled in October 2016 it is one of only 575 bottles.
This is bottle number 30.

This was a limited release of 11,550 bottles and is a peated malt which was distilled in 2013 and bottled 2018 at the cask strength of 55.5%.
In 2007, Ichiro Akuto, the grandson of the founder of the Hanyu Distillery, started a new chapter in Japans whisky industry by building CHchibu distillery. Some of the equipment includes a small mill, mash tun and washback made of Japanese Oak.
This is bottle number 10294.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Auchroisk - 16 Year Old - The Manager's Dram
DESCRIPTION:
This 16 year old single malt from the Auchroisk Distillery is part of The Manager's Dram series exclusively for Diageo employees (formerly United Distillers).  It was bottled in November 2015 at 55.6%. 
The Diageo Managers Dram bottlings, each selected by distillery managers, are bottled at natural cask strength.

The Glenfiddich range has a new member, Grand Cru.
'The ultimate spirit of celebration' was released on general sale at the distillery in 2019 and has been matured for 23 years in American and European oak casks.
The finishing touch is the expression being finished in French cuvée casks.

Ardbeg Ten Year Old is known around the world as the peatiest, smokiest, most complex single malt of them all. Yet it does not flaunt the peat; rather it gives way to the natural sweetness of the malt to produce a whisky of perfect balance. Named World Whisky of the Year in 2008.
Produced on the Kildalton Coast of Islay, this single malt matures for a decade before being bottled without any chill-filtration with a strength of 46% ABV.

This now-discontinued Hibiki 12 year old is a superb blended Japanese whisky meaning it has become a very popular, rare and collectable bottling. Hibiki includes malt whisky from Yamazaki and Hakushu, as well as grain whisky from Chita. The whisky is partly matured in plum liqueur barrels.  Unfortunately, Hibiki 12 was discontinued by Suntory in 2015.

The Macallan Ruby is from the 1824 series.  Other bottles in the series include Macallan Gold, Sienna and Amber. As you can tell from the colouring this bottle is very full of character and most certainly at the higher end of the flavour spectrum.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bruichladdich - 16 Year Old Cuvee C Margaux​
DESCRIPTION:
Bruichladdich 16 year old, matured in bourbon casks initially before being transferred into first growth wine barrels from Chateau LaFleur. This is highly respected vineyard across the world.
Bruichladdich's did a series named "First Growth" which all were finished in Bordeaux wine casks.
This is the 3rd release in the series and is limited to 12000 bottles.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bowmore - 12 Year Old - Commonwealth Championship Islay 2009
DESCRIPTION:
A limited edition from No1 Vaults in islay to celebrate the Commonweatlh Fly Fishing Championships held on Islay in 2009.
A very rare bottle and becoming increasingly hard to get a hold of.
Like fishing? This bottle could be for you!!

21 Year Old Highland Park is considered one of the best expressions Highland Park produces by many.  Originally created exclusively for global travel retail and duty-free markets, this whisky was named Best Single Malt of the Year at the World Whisky Awards 2009. Released in October 2007, Highland Park 21 is a full-flavoured, powerful, sweet single malt with a rich smoky finish.

The third release in the Macallan Edition series.  A unique selection of oak cask styles are combined to yield a new limited edition expression each year.  
Edition No.3 was a collaboration between master perfumer Roja Dove and master whisky maker Bob Dalgarno.  With Dove's remarkable sensory knowledge, Dalgarno shaped the character of Edition No.3 from a combination of European and American oak casks to create a deliciously sweet, single malt with floral notes.

Matured in American oak and Oloroso sherry casks – Ardbeg Traigh Bhan is a 19 year old whisky and the Distillery’s latest small batch release. Inspired by Islay’s Traigh Bhan beach (known locally as the Singing Sands), this rare aged spirit is an enchanting reflection of the place to which it gets its name.

The 'On The Way' series by Chichibu charts the fledgeling distillery's progress over the years.  This is the 2015 release of Chichibu On The Way.  It is a multi-vintage vatting of whisky distilled from when they opened in 2008, including some of their oldest whiskies which has been matured in bourbon casks then finished in Mizunara casks.  This bottling is already very popular with Japanese whisky enthusiasts as it showcases the skill of distiller Ichiro Akuto and his team.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glendronach - 21 Year Old - 1994 Single PX Cask #339
DESCRIPTION:
Distilled in December 1994 and bottled in September 2016 this release is part of batch #14 of the Glendronach single cask series.  It was matured a single Pedro Ximenez Sherry Puncheon #339 for 21 years.  This is one of 547 individually bottles.
This is bottle number 520.

This is the first instalment in the Wolfburn Distillery Kylver collectors’ series. 
The first Kylver release was matured in bourbon barrels. It was released in August 2016 at 46%. This is one of 1200 bottles. 
 
The Kylver series follows the Viking runic alphabet engraved on a large stone excavated in Gotland (Sweden) in 1903.  The fourth symbol  is called “Ansuz”, which roughly translates as “god” or “gods”.  
Wolfburn Distillery is located in Thurso, making it the Northern most distillery on the UK mainland.  Based around a long lost distillery that ended around 1850, this new Wolfburn reopened in 2013.

This limited edition Lagavulin was exclusively available at the distillery in 2010. It was bottled at natural cask strength with the remnant of whisky from a previous bottling run of Distiller's Edition. It was then re-casked and left for a few extra years.

This is the first instalment in the Wolfburn Distillery Kylver collectors’ series. 
The first Kylver release was matured in bourbon barrels. It was released in August 2016 at 46%. This is one of 1200 bottles. 
The Kylver series follows the Viking runic alphabet engraved on a large stone excavated in Gotland (Sweden) in 1903.  The fourth symbol  is called “Ansuz”, which roughly translates as “god” or “gods”.  
Wolfburn Distillery is located in Thurso, making it the Northern most distillery on the UK mainland.  Based around a long lost distillery that ended around 1850, this new Wolfburn reopened in 2013.

A 23-year-old Glendronach and the UK exclusive this single malt was matured in an Oloroso Sherry butt.
Bottled in October 2016 it is one of only 575 bottles.

Enigma is at the top end of Macallan's Quest Collection (released for the Travel Retail market).  The expression has been drawn exclusively from European oak Sherry seasons casks from one cooperage in Jerez de la Frontera, Spain.  The Macallan Enigma is a testament that every end has a new beginning, always venturing on the brink of a new discovery.

The 2019 Fèis Ìle release from Lagavulin was a 19 year old single malt, matured in three types of casks: refill American oak cask, second Sherry treated American oak cask and a European oak puncheon. 6000 bottles were released.
Colin Gordon, Lagavulin distillery manager, said: ‘This bottle is extra special because it’s been chosen by everyone here – from the visitor centre to the warehouse teams.'

Following on from The Valhalla Collection, this limited edition Highland Park also comes with a cradle, which is shaped like a mountain as opposed to a longship.
Matured mostly in bourbon casks, this bottling was released in honour of the Ice Realm of Niflheim (hence the cut blue glass bottle). This land of perpetual ice and cold is home to the frozen river of Elivágar and the well of Hvergelmir! There are Nine Worlds in Norse mythology, but this two-part series is completed by Highland Park Fire Edition.

Matured in American oak and Oloroso sherry casks – Ardbeg Traigh Bhan is a 19 year old whisky and the Distillery’s latest small batch release. Inspired by Islay’s Traigh Bhan beach (known locally as the Singing Sands), this rare aged spirit is an enchanting reflection of the place to which it gets its name.

'An Oa' was the first addition to Ardbeg's core range for a decade when introduced in 2017.  It is made up from a combination of spirit aged in Pedro-Ximenez sherry casks and bourbon barrels. Married in a French-oak marrying vat, this is rounded and smoky with notes of toffee, aniseed, date and banana.

Matured in American oak and Oloroso sherry casks – Ardbeg Traigh Bhan is a 19 year old whisky and the Distillery’s latest small batch release. Inspired by Islay’s Traigh Bhan beach (known locally as the Singing Sands), this rare aged spirit is an enchanting reflection of the place to which it gets its name.

Matured in American oak and Oloroso sherry casks – Ardbeg Traigh Bhan is a 19 year old whisky and the Distillery’s latest small batch release. Inspired by Islay’s Traigh Bhan beach (known locally as the Singing Sands), this rare aged spirit is an enchanting reflection of the place to which it gets its name.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 18 Year Old - Bennachie Special reserve
DESCRIPTION:
This Bennachie Special Reserve bottling of Highland Park was distilled in 1988 and aged for 18 years before being one of only 528 bottles bottled from single cask no.11921.
This is bottle number 22.

Distilled in 1998, Ardbeg Still Young was released in 2006.
It is part of a series called the ‘path to peaty maturity’ of which this is the second release.
This was a very limited release by Bunnahabhain - it is one of 310 bottles.  This is a cask-strength, peated expression - 'Moine' is the Scottish Gaelic word for 'peat'.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bruichladdich - 21 Year Old Cuvee #407 PX Finish
DESCRIPTION: This is one of the three initial releases in Bruichladdich's Cuvee range. Cuvee 407 is simply named PX and is subtitled 'La Noche Bocca Arriba', the title of a short story by Julio Cortázar.  It is a 21 year old single malt, matured in American oak and then finished in Pedro Ximenez casks.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glendronach - 20 Year Old - 1996 Single PX Cask #1485
DESCRIPTION:
Distilled in February 1996 and bottled in September 2016 this release is part of batch #14 of the Glendronach single cask series.  It was matured a single Pedro Ximenez Sherry Puncheon #1485 for 20 years.  This is one of 596 individually numbered bottles.
This is bottle number 534.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Hibiki - Japanese Harmony Master's Select Limited Edition
DESCRIPTION:
The new kid on the block for Hibiki, blending ten plus single malts and grains. These include Yamazaki, Hakushu, and Chita.
5 types of casks were used and typical Hibiki fashion the bottle always has 24 facets which represent 24 seasons in the Japanese lunar calendar.
Shinji Fukuyo, the fourth-gen blender has his name to this bottle. However, it wasn't without careful guidance from the third generation master blender.

A limited-edition bottling of single malt from the Arran distillery to celebrate their 21st anniversary! The whisky used was distilled during the first three years of their production, matured in Sherry hogsheads. This is one of 5,988 bottles produced.

The Macallan Rare Cask is comprised of 16 different sherry-cask styles, the majority of which are first fill.  Rich and complex with notes of dark honey and dried fruit, this bridges the gap between The 1824 Series and The 1824 Collection.

This limited edition single malt from Bunnahabhain Distillery has been matured for 17 years.  For the last 5 years, the whisky was finished in Sauternes hogsheads. This release is one of 3 by Bunnahabhain for Fèis Ìle 2019. It has been bottled at 54.2% ABV. This is one of only 1118 bottles produced.
This is bottle number 0699.

The fifth release in the Edition Series from The Macallan, The Macallan Edition No. 5 celebrates The Macallan’s extensive natural colour spectrum and the intricate whisky-making process, in partnership with masters at the Pantone Color Institute™ to create a unique shade of purple that features on the packaging.

From the Speyside region comes this well-aged malt. Traditionally most of the archive bottles are where the distillery managers will keep the best casks.

DESCRIPTION: This is a limited edition, single malt Scotch whisky from Springbank distillery bottled and released in 2019.  The whisky was fully matured in rum casks for 15 years.   Bottled at a cask strength of 51.0% this is one of only 9,000 bottles released worldwide.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Old Pulteney - Single Cask #441 1990  Glasgow Airport
DESCRIPTION:
A single cask, number 441, of Old Pulteney.

This is bottle number 47 of 150.

400 bottles were produced of this rather patriotic dram. It was only made available at the distillery and made to celebrate the 2013 Lions tour.
The 23 year old malt was eventually finished in Pomerol. 
Distilled: October 16th 1989
Number 124 of 400 bottles.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Johnnie Walker - Blue Label - Madrid Limited Edition
DESCRIPTION: A limited-edition bottling of Johnnie Walker Blue Label with a cityscape of Madrid on the bottle label and box.  The design captures the essence of the vibrant city of Madrid.

This Japanese 10 year old is becoming sought after by collectors. Distilled at Yoichi, the first distillery founded by Nikka founder Masataka Taketsuru in 1934, this Japanese single malt was bottled at 45% ABV.

Released in 2018 for the Taiwanese market, Macallan Aera was matured in seasoned sherry casks and features lots of dried fruit flavours on the palate.  It was bottled at 40% ABV and as the label says, it was made with some thoughtfulness in mind.

This limited edition release from Amrut is the second in their Spectrum series.  This Indian single malt was first matured in bourbon barrels,  then finished in casks four types of oak - Oloroso Sherry oak staves, Pedro Ximenéz Sherry oak staves, new French oak and new American oak.

This Mortlach 16 year old single malt is part of the 26-bottle 'Flora & Fauna' series, made famous by whisky writer Michael Jackson. This bottling has been discontinued and is no longer available from Diageo's Flora and Fauna series.  It is becoming increasingly hard to find.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Teaninich - 17 Years Old - Limited Release Bicentenary
DESCRIPTION:
Released to celebrate 200 years of the distillery, this bicentenary bottle is beautifully designed from the now-closed distillery.
Released in 2017 and distilled in 1999, this 17-year-old will become harder to find as the years go on as the closed distillery bottlings become more saught after year on year.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 12 Year Old - St. Magnus
DESCRIPTION:
The second in one of the most popular series Highland Park have released, the Orkenyinga Saga trilogy consisting of; Earl Magnus, Saint Magnus and Earl Haakon.  St Magnus was murdered by his cousin Earl Haakon, who himself was honoured with a Highland Park bottling. 
This 12-Year-Old single mlat was distilled in 1999 and was ottled at cask the strength of 55%. This is one of 11,994 bottles of Saint Magnus.

Bruichladdich unique Micro-Provenance series is a series of single cask bottlings, released exclusively online.
This 17 year old is a limited edition of just 335 individually numbered bottles.  It was matured in fresh bourbon American Oak cask & Bolgheri cask #013 in warehouse 5/2. It was filled in Feb 1882 and then bottled in Septemebr 2009, at 63.6% ABV.

The 2018 version combines Oloroso and Pedro Ximenez sherry cask malts. but the original is only from Oloroso Sherry.

A limited edition, this expression was matured for 10 years in mountain oak until being bottled at its natural strength.
BEfore 1700 the farmers of Ross-shire originally supplied malt whisky to the royal burgh of Tain, the home of Glenmorangie.
Aromas: Cloves, cinnamon, vanilla. honey and citrus fruits.

The Island single malt was bottled to celebrate 200 years of the Jura Distillery.
 Finished in a 1963 sherry cask, rich and full-bodied with flavours of crushed pear, oranges and soft liquorice.
Each bottle comes with a personal invitation from Willie Cochrane, the Jura distillery manager.
This bottle has been signed by Willie himself!

The New Century brand took over in the year 2000 marking the turn of the Millennium.
Casks #4689-4691 were merged and bottled in 1999 after being distilled 25 years before in 1974.
 
This bottle is signed by Richard Paterson.

This is Committee exclusive release of Ardbeg Kelpie, a single malt released in 2017.  It was matured in casks made from virgin Black Sea oak and more traditional bourbon casks. The Committee Release is bottled at the higher strength of 51.7% ABV (while the standard Ardbeg Kelpie has bottled at 46% ABV).

'Companta' by Glenmorangie, follows on from 'Ealanta', which was named as World Whisky of the Year 2014 by Jim Murray. 'This Private Edition Companta was a very popular release, selling out quickly from most retailers.
After first maturing in American white oak ex-bourbon barrels, the Companta was matured in 60% Burgundy wine casks from Clos de Tart and 40% Rhône Valley casks that previously held Rasteau, sourced by Glenmorangie's Director of Distilling, Dr. Bill Lumsden.
The result is an exceedingly well-made cherry red, non-chill-filtered single malt that fits perfectly into the continuing range of experimental releases from Glenmorangie.

DESCRIPTION:
This is one of just 3000 bottles in this release by Bowmore which was sold exclusively at the distillery, during Fèis Ìle 2018.  This single malt has been matured exclusively in first-fill Oloroso sherry casks for 15 years.  It was bottled at the cask strength of 52.5% ABV.
 
 
This is bottle number 0054.

This bottle was released by Caol Ila's to celebrate Fèis Ìle 2014. It is a 12 year old matured in refill American oak Hogsheads, personally selected by David Wood.  It was bottled at the natural cask strength of 55.5%. 
This is bottle number 0020.

Highland Parks last batch of the 18 Year Old single malt before the new packaging of the 18 Year Old Viking Pride.
756 bottles were hand signed by Whisky Makers Max McFarlane and Gordon Motion.

This is a special Highland Park release, bottled to commemorate the 150th anniversary of the first RNLI lifeboat being launched at Stromness on Orkney in 1987.
To mark the bravery and dedicated service of the RNLI, Highland Park released exactly 1,867 anniversary bottles in January 2018.  Since the Severn class lifeboat stationed in Stromness is 55.9 feet long, they bottled this special edition of Highland Park at 55.9% ABV.
This is one of 1,867 bottles.

Highland Park Sigurd was originally a Travel Retail Exclusive and was released as part of the warrior series.  It was partially matured in European oak. It is named after a legendary hero of Norse mythology.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 14 Year Old - Single Cask #1932 - Copenhagen Airport
DESCRIPTION: This bottling is part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series and was bottled exclusively for Copenhagen Airport.  Distilled in 2003, this single malt was matured for 14 years in refill butt #1932 at was bottled at the cask strength of 59.7% ABV in 2018.  With only 300 bottles available, this is an extremely limited edition. This is one of 585 bottles

The special edition takes its name from a peat moor.  This environment creates a unique aromatic peat consisting of decaying heather and plants rather than the trees that characterise the peat used by other distilleries.
A release of 1,200 bottles.

Fully matured in 4 different handpicked European and American Oak casks.
