This expression is only available for Taiwanese travel retailers.
Fully matured in 4 different handpicked European and American Oak casks.

This is the 2019 Ardbeg Drum Limited edition.  The Ardbeg Drum is a non-age-statement single malt matured in ex-Bourbon casks and then finished in ex-rum casks from the Americas.  It was created to celebrate Ardbeg Day 2019 (June 1) held during the Islay Festival of Music & Malt (Fèis Ìle).
This limited-edition is bottled at 46% abv.

This is an older, rare bottling of the original Ardbeg 10 year old released in 2000 following Glenmorangie buy over.  The box features a diagonal band in the corner of the box introducing the Ardbeg 10.
Ardbeg Ten Year Old is known around the world as the peatiest, smokiest, most complex single malt of them all. Yet it does not flaunt the peat; rather it gives way to the natural sweetness of the malt to produce a whisky of perfect balance. Named World Whisky of the Year in 2008.
Produced on the Kildalton Coast of Islay, this single malt matures for a decade before being bottled without any chill-filtration with a strength of 46% ABV.
An older style official bottling of 1984 vintage Glen Garioch.
Matured exclusively in oak sherry casks from Jerez in Spain.  This age statement was discontinued by Macallan in 2013.

This is a 12 Year Old expression from the Hakushu distillery, which lies in the foothills of Mount Kaikomagatake. 
This Japanese bottling is becoming more and more popular each year.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 14 Year Old - Single Cask #2542 - Hsiu Ming
DESCRIPTION: This bottling is part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series and was bottled exclusively for Hsiu Ming.  Distilled in 2002, this single malt was matured for 14 years in first fill European sherry oak butt #2542 and was bottled at the cask strength of 59.8% ABV.  With only 636 bottles available, this is a limited edition.

Hobbister is the first release in the Highland Park Keystone Series – a collection of special bottlings that highlight our five Keystones of production which combine to make Highland Park stand apart from other Single Malts.
The special edition takes its name from a peat moor.  This environment creates a unique aromatic peat consisting of decaying heather and plants rather than the trees that characterise the peat used by other distilleries.
A release of 1,200 bottles.

The Macallan 12 Year Old was exclusively matured in selected sherry oak casks from Jerez, Spain.
This 12 year old was a late addition by Macallan before the age statement range was discontinued in 2013 - This bottle is now hard to find in the UK.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glen Garioch - That Boutique-y Whisky Company #1
DESCRIPTION:
This is a 50cl bottling of That Boutique-y Whisky Company's is from Batch 1 of their Glen Garioch releases and this is one of a limited release of just 284 bottles.  Bottled at 50.6% ABV.  Glen Garioch was founded all the way back in 1797 in Oldmeldrum, making it one of the oldest Scotch whisky distilleries around.  The hand-illustrated label features Ryan Chetiyawardana time-travelling back to 1977 to check out the greenhouse which Glen Garioch heated using the waste heat from their stills.
That Boutique-y Whisky Company’ bottles single malts, single grains, blended malts, blends and bourbons from a variety of renowned distilleries. These whiskies are adorned with cultish graphic-novel-style labels.
This is bottle No.26.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Mortlach - 20 Year Old - Cowie's Blue Seal
DESCRIPTION:
Matured in American Oak Sherry Casks for 20 years this Speyside malt was released in 2018.
Alexander Cowie would most certainly be proud of this bottling. It is said to be modelled on a batch of bottles that his daughter found back in 1973 inside a wooden box when they were renovating a house.
Be careful though, are you ready to handle "The Beast of Dufftown"?

This is the 2019 Ardbeg Committee Release.  The Ardbeg Drum is a non-age-statement single malt matured in ex-Bourbon casks and then finished in ex-rum casks from the Americas.  It was created to celebrate Ardbeg Day 2019 (June 1) held during the Islay Festival of Music & Malt (Fèis Ìle).
This limited-edition Committee Release is bottled at 52% abv, and was released exclusively to Ardbeg Committee Members.
Originally a travel retail exclusive released in 2012, this special bottling celebrates the 125th anniversary of Glenfiddich's opening, with spirit running from the stills on Christmas day 1887.

This bottling is the Wolfburn distilleries 1st release for the Japanese market.
Wolfburn Distillery is located in Thurso, making it the Northern most distillery on the UK mainland. Based around a long lost distillery that ended around 1850, this new Wolfburn reopened in 2013.
A special ceramic decanter from Glenfiddich, part of a series to recognise famous Scots. This edition carries a picture of Robert the Bruce.

This is the 2019 Ardbeg Committee Release.  The Ardbeg Drum is a non-age-statement single malt matured in ex-Bourbon casks and then finished in ex-rum casks from the Americas.  It was created to celebrate Ardbeg Day 2019 (June 1) held during the Islay Festival of Music & Malt (Fèis Ìle).
This limited-edition Committee Release is bottled at 52% abv, and was released exclusively to Ardbeg Committee Members.

This special edition Ardbeg single malt was released on Ardbeg Day 2014. during Feis Ile.  Auri(Gold) verdes (Green) it refers to the golden whisky and the iconic Ardbeg green bottle of Ardbeg whisky.  It is said to be a dram of two halves -  the whisky uses toasted cask lids to create Mocha Coffee flavours that team up with creamy vanilla.

This 12 year old Yamazaki is said to be multi-layered in taste and is highly praised by whisky connoisseurs.  It first came onto the scene in 1984 and was the first seriously marketed Japanese single malt whisky.  Yamazaki is arguably the number 1 single malt whisky in Japan and this would be a great contender for Suntory’s flagship single malt.
This striking older-style presentation of Bowmore 10 Year Old single malt from the now highly sought screened label bottlings that were released between 1990 and 1995.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Islay House - 2004 Port Charlotte - Fèis Ìle 2015
DESCRIPTION: This limited-edition single-cask bottling of Bruichladdich's Port Charlotte was distilled in 2004 and released at Feis Ile in 2015.  It was matured in a Cadiz single cask and bottled at 55% ABV.  It was exclusively available from the Islay House hotel, which was in the middle of being refurbished before their planned reopening.  This is one of 334 individually numbered bottles.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 10 Year Old - 1999 Whisky Live
DESCRIPTION: This is a limited edition 10-year-old Highland Park bottled to commemorate 10 years of Whisky Live.  It was distilled in 1999, matured in sherry Oak casks, bottled in 2009 at the cask strength of 59.3%.  This is a limited edition of only 600 bottles.

One of 700 bottles commissioned for Feis Isle 2013 comes the Bruichladdich Laddie Five-O.
This was labelled 'Jim McEwan's tribute to 50 years of whisky creation'
This is a combination of selected Bruichladdich vintages which will reflect the blood sweat and tears that have gone into making this malt what it is today.
Bottle number 406 of 700

Released in 2013 for Ardbeg Day during Fèis Ìsle, Ardbog is a 10-Year-Old single malt by Ardbeg.  It is made from a vatting of whisky matured in a combination of bourbon casks and manzanilla casks, creating a balanced soft, sweet and earthy flavour.  In the World Whiskies Awards 2014, Ardbog won Best Islay Whisky NAS.
A 1987 vintage The Glenrothes, bottled in 1999 by the brand's owners Berry Brothers & Rudd.

An alligator skin is one that looks cracked and full of scars that would have been caused during a heated battle. Well, that exactly where the name of this whisky comes from. When heat is applied to the inside of a cask, the wood begins to crack...'alligator char'.
This is the un-tammed release which came after the committee release in 2012.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 12 Year Old - Single Cask Series - 58 Albert Street
DESCRIPTION: This 12 year old single malt was distilled 200, matured in Refill Butt number 1791 and bottled in 2017, as part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series.  This limited edition of just 540 bottles, was released to celebrate the opening of 58 Albert Street, Kirkwall.

This 14 Year Old from Scapa Distillery was a shortlived bottling -it was introduced by Chivas Brothers to replace the old 12 Year Old, but was subsequently replaced by their 16 year old standard official bottling.

This is a distillery exclusive bottling from Clynelish Distillery.  It is a limited edition of just 6,000 bottles.  Matured in a bourbon cask, this single malt was personally selected by the distillery team and bottled at 48% ABV.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Blanton's - Single Barrel Black Label - Dumped 2019 (Japanese Import)
DESCRIPTION:
Blanton's Single Barbor is normally 6 to 8 year old bourbon, aged in Warehouse H at Buffalo Trace in the metal-clad warehouse at the distillery. The metal, transfers heat quicker than brick warehouses, allowing for faster ageing.
This Single Cask Blanton's is a 2019 bottling, dumped on the 17h January 2019 and matured in barrel #17. It was matured in Warehouse H, and was stored in rick number 27 and bottled at 80 US proof.
This is bottle number 64.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Wolfburn -  'A Little Something Different' - La Maison du Whisky - 60th Anniversary
DESCRIPTION:
This release celebrates the 60th Anniversary of La Maison du Whisky.  The single malt was matured in an Ex-Bourbon American Oak Barrel and a European Oak Octave married together to create this limited bottling.
This is one of just 589 Bottles.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Wolfburn -  'A Little Something Different' - La Maison du Whisky - 60th Anniversary
DESCRIPTION:
This release celebrates the 60th Anniversary of La Maison du Whisky.  The single malt was matured in an Ex-Bourbon American Oak Barrel and a European Oak Octave married together to create this limited bottling.
This is one of just 589 Bottles.

An alligator skin is one that looks cracked and full of scars that would have been caused during a heated battle. Well, that exactly where the name of this whisky comes from. When heat is applied to the inside of a cask, the wood begins to crack...'alligator char'.
This is the un-tammed release which came after the committee release in 2012.

An alligator skin is one that looks cracked and full of scars that would have been caused during a heated battle. Well, that exactly where the name of this whisky comes from. When heat is applied to the inside of a cask, the wood begins to crack...'alligator char'.
This is the un-tammed release which came after the committee release in 2012.

This 25 year old Tamnavulin was distilled in 1974 and bottled under the New Century brand in 2000.
Cask numbers #5989 to 5993.

From the Taiwanese whisky distillery in Yuanshan Township, Yilan County, Taiwan.
The name of the distillery comes from the people who lived there originally. With its first spirit being produced in March 2006 it has gone from strength to strength.
This peaty cask expression is quite rare and was selected by "Whisky Nerds".
This is bottle number 47 of 99.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Johnnie Walker - Blue Label - Madrid Limited Edition
DESCRIPTION: A limited-edition bottling of Johnnie Walker Blue Label with a cityscape of Madrid on the bottle label and box.  The design captures the essence of the vibrant city of Madrid.

This is the first-ever release of single malt whisky from the Kilchoman Distillery. This Inaugural Release was aged for between 2.5 and 3 years in bourbon casks, before being finished for 6 months in sherry casks. Very good indeed. Malt Advocate rated it with 92 points.

This is the first-ever release of single malt whisky from the Kilchoman Distillery. This Inaugural Release was aged for between 2.5 and 3 years in bourbon casks, before being finished for 6 months in sherry casks. Very good indeed. Malt Advocate rated it with 92 points.
A high-end blend packaged in a well-designed bottle. This bottle is hard to find on general sale.

This is the 2019 Ardbeg Drum Limited edition.  The Ardbeg Drum is a non-age-statement single malt matured in ex-Bourbon casks and then finished in ex-rum casks from the Americas.  It was created to celebrate Ardbeg Day 2019 (June 1) held during the Islay Festival of Music & Malt (Fèis Ìle).
This limited-edition is bottled at 46% abv.

Cairdeas, Gaelic for 'friendship', is an annual bottle release by Laphroaig for their Friends of Laphroaig members.  This bottling was originally aged in ex-bourbon barrels before being re-casked in Madeira seasoned traditional hogsheads. It was bottled at 51.6% ABV.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - Single Cask Series - Brünnhilde 2008
DESCRIPTION:
Part of the Highland PArk single cask series comes this bottling for Der Ring des Nibelungen Brünnhilde.
Bottled in 2019 and distilled in 2008, this expression matured for 11 years in a first-fill American Oak cask #146.

This is an increasingly popular dram - after a controversial bebinning for the 16 year old official expression of Scapa, it is now winning people over. An increase in quality after a few under-par years following the rapid transition from the much-loved 12 year old via the short-lived 14 year old has started to turn things around.

This is a 12 Year Old expression from the Hakushu distillery, which lies in the foothills of Mount Kaikomagatake. 
This Japanese bottling is becoming more and more popular each year.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Miltonduff - Cask Strength 1997 - 1st Fill Sherry Butt
DESCRIPTION:
Gordon & MacPhail has one, if not the largest selection of Malt whiskies in the world...it helps they have been producing for over 120 years!
This is another fine example of a high class and quality products from the company! Bottled in its natural colour and non chill filtered, this 20-year expression is one of our favourites.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glenfarclas 2004 - Cask Strength Premium Edition - Sherry Casks
DESCRIPTION: This is a cask-strength release of Glenfarclas released to the Geerman market in 2015. Distilled in 2004, matured in sherry casks and bottled at 59.4% abv.ta rich and complex sherried Speysider with notes of caramel and dark chocolate. This is one of 6000 bottles produced.

'Hillhead' bottled at 46% ABV, marries both flavour and strength and was matured in three casks: European Oak Sherry, American Oak Sherry and American Oak Bourbon.  Hillhead was the last in a series of five special editions, showcasing Highland Park's five keystones of production.

This 12 year old Yamazaki is said to be multi-layered in taste and is highly praised by whisky connoisseurs.  It first came onto the scene in 1984 and was the first seriously marketed Japanese single malt whisky.  Yamazaki is arguably the number 1 single malt whisky in Japan and this would be a great contender for Suntory’s flagship single malt.
The ‘Legend’ is a no-age-statement whisky that showcases Bowmore Distillery’s classic peat smoke.  A young, rather gentle Bowmore.

A quality release in 2014 from The Beast of Dufftown after being matured for 18 yearsbottling in sherry and refill American oak casks.
The distillery is also an integral part of Diageo's Johnnie walker.

This is a 12 Year Old expression from the Hakushu distillery, which lies in the foothills of Mount Kaikomagatake. 
This Japanese bottling is becoming more and more popular each year.

This is a 12 Year Old expression from the Hakushu distillery, which lies in the foothills of Mount Kaikomagatake. 
This Japanese bottling is becoming more and more popular each year.

At 50% ABv this is a rare bottling from the Chivas company and is becoming harder to find.
Very popular in the Asian market due to the shape of the bottle. They use it to play games as it acts like a spinning top.

This is a 12 Year Old expression from the Hakushu distillery, which lies in the foothills of Mount Kaikomagatake. 
This Japanese bottling is becoming more and more popular each year.

This is a 12 Year Old expression from the Hakushu distillery, which lies in the foothills of Mount Kaikomagatake. 
This Japanese bottling is becoming more and more popular each year.

From the highland distillery comes this 14 Year Old single malt from Glendronach.
This expression as matured in European Oak initially before being finished in Marsala Casks.

A Bladnoch Forum bottling of Invergordon.
Bottled on the 9th July 2009, from cask 66438.
Bottle 3 of 108.
A high-end blend packaged in a well-designed bottle. This bottle is hard to find on general sale.

From the Speyside region comes this well-aged malt. Traditionally most of the archive bottles are where the distillery managers will keep the best casks.
This is part of the exceptional and rare cask selection.
Batch Number: 1115N

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glenmorangie - 10 Year Old - Grand Slam Dram
DESCRIPTION:
This bottle of Glenmorangie 10 Year Old was released in celebration of the Scottish Rugby Team's Grand Slam win in 1990 - the victory took place on 17th March 1990 and this is detailed on the neck label. 
This is a 75cl bottling.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 12 Year Old - Single Cask Series - 58 Albert Street
DESCRIPTION: This 12 year old single malt was distilled 200, matured in Refill Butt number 1791 and bottled in 2017, as part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series.  This limited edition of just 540 bottles, was released to celebrate the opening of 58 Albert Street, Kirkwall.

This is an increasingly popular dram - after a controversial bebinning for the 16 year old official expression of Scapa, it is now winning people over. An increase in quality after a few under-par years following the rapid transition from the much-loved 12 year old via the short-lived 14 year old has started to turn things around.

This is a special Highland Park release, bottled to commemorate the 150th anniversary of the first RNLI lifeboat being launched at Stromness on Orkney in 1987.
To mark the bravery and dedicated service of the RNLI, Highland Park released exactly 1,867 anniversary bottles in January 2018.  Since the Severn class lifeboat stationed in Stromness is 55.9 feet long, they bottled this special edition of Highland Park at 55.9% ABV.
This is one of 1,867 bottles.

This single cask Scapa Distillery on Orkney was bottled by Iain Mackillop & Co. Matured for 22 years in cask #1211 the single malt was then bottled at the cask strength of 57.1% in 2013.
 
This is bottle number 026.

This limited edition Islay single malt was released to mark the 2018 Ardbeg Day at the Islay Festival of Music & Malt.  The theme is a throwback to the Island's 1960s spirit, embodying the ideals of 'peat & love'! Ardbeg Grooves is crafted with ex-wine casks that are re-charred to create heavy grooves in the wood, allowing more interaction with the spirit and creating a richer flavour.

This limited edition bottling was produced to celebrate Ardbeg Day at the 2017 Fèis Ìle.
This single malt from Islay is the distillery's first to use virgin oak from the Black Sea coast for maturation.  Therefore it imparts deep flavour notes that only a very small amount of whiskies have ever before.  It was then married in ex-Bourbon casks.  This dram is packed with the seaside flavours of Ardbeg and peat smoke.

This 17 year old Scapa is part of the Distillery Reserve Collection from Chivas Brothers' single malt whisky.  This was distilled on 14th November 2001 and bottled from a single first fill barrel on the 29th of May 2019.  It was bottled at cask strenght at 54.1% abv.  
This is one of 288 bottles produced. This is a 50cl bottling.
This is bottle number 73.

This is a special Highland Park release, bottled to commemorate the 150th anniversary of the first RNLI lifeboat being launched at Stromness on Orkney in 1987.
To mark the bravery and dedicated service of the RNLI, Highland Park released exactly 1,867 anniversary bottles in January 2018.  Since the Severn class lifeboat stationed in Stromness is 55.9 feet long, they bottled this special edition of Highland Park at 55.9% ABV.
This is one of 1,867 bottles.

Highland Park Ingvar is a cask strength special edition that is part of Highland Park's Viking Warrior Series.  It was released exclusively for Taiwan Duty Free.
Ingvar Ragnarsson was a warrior king known for his exceptional cruelty, strength and skill with many weapons.

This is a special Highland Park release, bottled to commemorate the 150th anniversary of the first RNLI lifeboat being launched at Stromness on Orkney in 1987.
To mark the bravery and dedicated service of the RNLI, Highland Park released exactly 1,867 anniversary bottles in January 2018.  Since the Severn class lifeboat stationed in Stromness is 55.9 feet long, they bottled this special edition of Highland Park at 55.9% ABV.
This is one of 1,867 bottles.

From the Isle of Skye Talisker 10 Year Old from the 1990s.This older style of the packaging features the Isle of Skye mapped on a stone. 
Talisker was originally formed in 1930 by Kenneth and Hugh Macaskill.   The two gentlemen are in fact brothers. The fire in November 1960 resulted in a new distillery being built which included two new stills. Now part of Diagio classic malt line up, a great one for island collectors and lovers of the Isle of Skye.

This is an increasingly popular dram - after a controversial bebinning for the 16 year old official expression of Scapa, it is now winning people over. An increase in quality after a few under-par years following the rapid transition from the much-loved 12 year old via the short-lived 14 year old has started to turn things around.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 14 Year Old - Single Cask #6140 - Routa
DESCRIPTION: This bottling is part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series and was bottled exclusively for Routa.  Distilled in 2003, this single malt was matured for 14 years in first fill European Sherry Butt #6140 at a cask strength of 59.5% ABV.  With only 645 bottles available, this is a limited edition.

The Glendronach 18 Year Old Allardice continues to follow its ethos with this heavily sherried Whisky.
It has been matured in Oloroso casks and because of its closure in 1996 some of these 18 year old expressions released after 2015 will be much older than stated.
This one-litre bottling of 12-Year-Old Bowmore. This single malt has coastal notes with gentle peat. This is a 1-litre bottling.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 15 Year Old - Single Cask #3445 - Le Clos
DESCRIPTION: This bottling is part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series and was bottled exclusively for Le Clos. Distilled in 2002 this single malt was matured for 15 years in refill Hogshead #3445 at the cask strength of 58.2% ABV.  With only 306 bottles available, this is a very limited edition.

This limited edition bottling was produced to celebrate Ardbeg Day at the 2017 Fèis Ìle.
This single malt from Islay is the distillery's first to use virgin oak from the Black Sea coast for maturation.  Therefore it imparts deep flavour notes that only a very small amount of whiskies have ever before.  It was then married in ex-Bourbon casks.  This dram is packed with the seaside flavours of Ardbeg and peat smoke.

Bottled in 2005 this Glenrothes from Speyside was distilled in 1987.
They have bottled a limited selection from a year whose quality is deemed exceptional.
As with wine, each Glenrothes vintage has its own personality, yet it still bears the distillery character.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 13 Year Old - Single Cask #6569 -  World Duty Free & Glasgow Airport
DESCRIPTION: This bottling is part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series and was bottled exclusively for World Duty Free & Glasgow Airport.  Distilled in 2004, this single malt was matured for 13 years in refill butt #6569 at the cask strength of 63.5% ABV.  With only 660 bottles available, this is a limited edition.
This is the third limited-edition release of Octomore Ten. It is made up of whisky that has been aged for 10 years in casks that previously held port, cognac and bourbon as well as virgin oak casks.

Matured for 12 years in a Sherry butt in the beautiful Scottish highlands.
This bottle is one of only 666 produced. Unlucky for some, but if you look to the dark it may just be right up your street.
This was bottled for Vinothek Massen.
This is bottle number 626.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 13 Years Old - Single Cask Series Dannerbrog #1933
DESCRIPTION:
One of 648 bottles coming from a refill butt, this highland Park  was distilled 2003 and bottled to celebrate Dannebrog 808th Anniversary.
A 13 Years of age the cask number was 1933.
Happy Anniversary!

This limited edition bottling was produced to celebrate Ardbeg Day at the 2017 Fèis Ìle.
This single malt from Islay is the distillery's first to use virgin oak from the Black Sea coast for maturation.  Therefore it imparts deep flavour notes that only a very small amount of whiskies have ever before.  It was then married in ex-Bourbon casks.  This dram is packed with the seaside flavours of Ardbeg and peat smoke.

This 12 year old Yamazaki is said to be multi-layered in taste and is highly praised by whisky connoisseurs.  It first came onto the scene in 1984 and was the first seriously marketed Japanese single malt whisky.  Yamazaki is arguably the number 1 single malt whisky in Japan and this would be a great contender for Suntory’s flagship single malt.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Johnnie Walker - A Song of Ice & A Song of Fire (2 x70cl)
DESCRIPTION: Johnnie Walker is continuing the 'legacy' of its relationship with Game of Thrones with the release of two limited edition blends – Johnnie Walker A Song of Ice and Song of Fire. A Song of Ice is a blended Scotch inspired by the Direwolves used as the sigil for the House of Stark.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Johnnie Walker - A Song of Ice & A Song of Fire (2 x70cl)
DESCRIPTION: Johnnie Walker is continuing the 'legacy' of its relationship with Game of Thrones with the release of two limited edition blends – Johnnie Walker A Song of Ice and Song of Fire. A Song of Ice is a blended Scotch inspired by the Direwolves used as the sigil for the House of Stark.
This is an old bottling of GlenDronach 12 Year Old Traditional single malt.  It was matured in seasoned oak and Sherry casks.  This is a bottle from the 1990s.
Glenmorangie Quinta Ruban is matured in bourbon casks before finishing in the finest Ruby Port casks from the "Quintas" or wine estates of Portugal. Ruban is Gaelic for Ruby.

This Glenfiddich 18 Year Old comes in a handsome Glenfiddich branded leatherette travel case with a branded document holder & luggage tag. 
The single malt was married in small batches - this is batch #3397, matured in a mixture of Oloroso Sherry and Bourbon casks.

Cutty Sark 25 Year Old is an old bottling by Berry Brothers and Rudd before they were sold to the drinks giant, Edrington.
Bottled at 45.7%, this bottle demands some serious respect.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 14 Year Old - Single Cask #2132 - The W Club
DESCRIPTION: This bottling is part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series and was bottled exclusively for The W Club.  Distilled in 2006, this single malt was matured for 11 years in first fill American Sherry Oak Puncheon #2132 and was bottled at the cask strength of 67% ABV.  With only 615 bottles available, this is an extremely limited edition.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 12 Year Old - Single Cask Series - 58 Albert Street
DESCRIPTION: This 12 year old single malt was distilled 200, matured in Refill Butt number 1791 and bottled in 2017, as part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series.  This limited edition of just 540 bottles, was released to celebrate the opening of 58 Albert Street, Kirkwall.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 15 Year Old - Single Cask #2154 - The Whiskey House
DESCRIPTION: This bottling is part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series and was bottled exclusively for The Whiskey House.  Distilled in 2003, this single malt was matured for 15 years in First Fill American Sherry Butt #2154 at the cask strength of 61.8% ABV.  With only 606 bottles available, this is a limited edition.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 12 Year Old - Single Cask Series - London Gatwick and World Duty Free
DESCRIPTION:
This Highland Park 12 Year Old was distilled in 2005 and bottled from a single refill butt #1140 in 2017 exclusively for London Gatwick and World Duty Free.
This is one of 540 bottles released as part of the Highland Park Single Cask Series.

Holding the prestigious title of "The Northernmost distillery on the UK mainland" Wolfburn has been working with various different local communities for bottlings. None more so than Dornoch.
This bottle was commission specifically for the 2017 Whisky Festival and is one of only 150 bottles. After reopening in 2013 Shane Fraser, the distillery manager said it has been an exciting adventure at the distillery and this bottle represents what Wolfburn is about.
 
This is bottle number 139.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 13 Year Old - Single Cask #2115 - Highland Park Appreciation Society
DESCRIPTION: This bottling is part of Highland Park's Single Cask Series and was bottled exclusively for Highland Park Appreciation Society.  Distilled in 2003, this single malt was matured for 13 years in refill butt #2115 at the cask strength of 59.1% ABV.  With only 576 bottles available, this is an extremely limited edition.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Benriach - 14 Year Old Single Cask King's Royal Hussars
DESCRIPTION:
Founded by the Grant family in 1898, the distillery was closed for 65 years.
The floor was in fact used by Longmorn distillery for the maltings right next door. Since then it can pride itself in winning 'Distillery of the Year' from Malt Advocate magazine in 2007.
Bottled for The King's Royal Hussars and was distilled in 1996.
This is bittle number 269 of 330.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 12 Year Old - Single Cask #2634 - Arlanda Airport

This is the second instalment in the Wolfburn Distillery Kylver series. 
This single malt whisky was drawn from a combination of bourbon barrels and second-fill ex-Oloroso Sherry. Released in May 2017 at 50% ABV. This is one of 1450 bottles. 
The Kylver series follows the Viking runic alphabet engraved on a large stone excavated in Gotland (Sweden) in 1903.  The fourth symbol  is called “Ansuz”, which roughly translates as “god” or “gods”.  
Wolfburn Distillery is located in Thurso, making it the Northern most distillery on the UK mainland.  Based around a long lost distillery that ended around 1850, this new Wolfburn reopened in 2013.
