DESCRIPTION: This is a special Emerald-coloured edition of Chivas' Royal Salute 21 Year Old blended whisky.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Whyte and Mackay - 21 Year Old - Masters Reserve
DESCRIPTION:
A Scottish blend from Whyte and Mackay which has been well matured to at least 21 years of age.
Bottled around the 1980's is said to full of rich flavours.

The Macallan 12 Year Old was exclusively matured in selected sherry oak casks from Jerez, Spain.
This 12 year old was a late addition by Macallan before the age statement range was discontinued in 2013 - This bottle is now hard to find in the UK.

This bottle is said to represent 150 years of experience of creating the best single malt in the world.
This 10 Year Old Glenfarclas is a classic sherry aged single malt - it is a sweet, spicy and malty dram.

A fully organic Bruichladdich 2003 - a century ago most barley was organically grown; natural fertilisers – seaweed, peat and manure – were harnessed in a way that respected the year’s agricultural cycle. 2003 was a particularly fine harvest of Chalice barley for William rose at Culblair Farm. Supreme quality barley combined with a slow trickle-distillation to do it justice, and new oak has resulted in Bruichladdichs creamiest release yet.  This is a limited edition release of 15,000 numbered bottles and Bruichladdichs first organic release - The name means 'In the Traditional Way.'
 
This is bottle number 4488 of 15000.

A special edition, released to support work of Orkney Rowing Club, this whisky has been bottled at 58%.  A percentage of the proceeds from the original sale of this bottle was donated to the Orkney Rowing Club. This is a limited edition release of only 4,000 bottles.

The Golf Open returned to Carnoustie in 2018, official 'Spirit of The Open' Loch Lomond partnered with Lawrie to create this 1999 vintage.  Matured in American oak casks this Highland single malt was bottled at cask strength and adorned by his signature. This is a limited release of 1,500 bottles.

Highland Park 12 year old - one of the best malts in the world year on year. This bottling has been in its core range for over 100 years!
This classic 1990's bottling was whisky author Michael Jackson’s favourite tipple.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Laphroaig - Càirdeas Triple Wood - Fèis Ìle 2019
DESCRIPTION: Cairdeas, Gaelic for 'friendship', is an annual bottle release by Laphroaig for their Friends of Laphroaig members.  This Càirdeas Triple Wood Cask Strength was released for Fèis Ìle 2019. It has had a special triple maturation; first matured in ex-bourbon barrels, then in quarter casks and finally in European oak casks which previously held oloroso sherry.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 16 Year Old Twisted Tattoo - 2019
DESCRIPTION:
For the first time, Highland Park have matured their whisky in oak casks seasoned with Spanish Rioja wine 153 in total.   There were 153 casks laid down in total.   This was married with another beautifully aged whisky, matured in 70 first-fill bourbon casks.
The result is immense and twisted tattoo was born.   A rich and full bodied 16 year old single malt.

Highland Park 12 year old - one of the best malts in the world year on year. This bottling has been in its core range for over 100 years.
Michael Jackson, Malt Whisky Companion regards this whisky as "The greatest all-rounder in the world of malt whisky."

Kirin Brewery Company of Japan purchased the Four Roses brand In February 2002 from Diageo. This was an exclusive release for the Japanese market.  The bourbon that makes up this Four Roses Super Premium 80% is said to be over 8 years old, while the other 20% is said to be 10 years or older.  This is a 75cl bottling.

Ardbeg Perpetuum Distillery Release was in 2015 in memory of the 200th anniversary of the Islay distillery.
Perpetuum is actually a blend of old and young whisky which has been matured in both Bourbon and Sherry casks.

Ardbeg Perpetuum Distillery Release was in 2015 in memory of the 200th anniversary of the Islay distillery.
Perpetuum is actually a blend of old and young whisky which has been matured in both Bourbon and Sherry casks.

Ardbeg Perpetuum Distillery Release was in 2015 in memory of the 200th anniversary of the Islay distillery.
Perpetuum is actually a blend of old and young whisky which has been matured in both Bourbon and Sherry casks.

Ardbeg Perpetuum Distillery Release was in 2015 in memory of the 200th anniversary of the Islay distillery.
Perpetuum is actually a blend of old and young whisky which has been matured in both Bourbon and Sherry casks.

Distilled in March 1986 this single grain was later bottled in March of 2010.
After 24 years of maturation in a hogshead cask number #18988. 
The distillery was founded in Cambus, near Alloa, in 1806 by John Moubray.

Highland Park 12 year old - one of the best malts in the world year on year. This bottling has been in its core range for over 100 years. This design of bottle was used by Highland Park from 1999-early 2000s.
This classic 1990s bottling was said to be whisky author Michael Jackson’s favourite tipple.

Highland Park 12 year old - one of the best malts in the world year on year. This bottling has been in its core range for over 100 years!
This classic 1990's bottling was whisky author Michael Jackson’s favourite tipple.

Redbreast is a single pot still whiskey distilled at New Midleton in Ireland using a combination of malted and un-malted barley. Triple distilled in copper pot stills. Redbreast 15 Year Old has won awards including a Gold Medal at the International Spirits Challenge 2010.

The Macallan 12 Year Old was exclusively matured in selected sherry oak casks from Jerez, Spain.
This 12 year old was a late addition by Macallan before the age statement range was discontinued in 2013 - This bottle is now hard to find in the UK.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Macallan - Gold - Limited Edition with 2x Glasses
DESCRIPTION:
A stylish Macallan gift pack.  It contains a 70cl bottle of the Gold expression from the Macallan 1824 Series, and two limited-edition branded Macallan whisky tumblers. 
The Gold was introduced as an alternative to Macallan 10 Year Old Fine Oak is at the light end of the colour/flavour spectrum.

A multi-vintage Bruichladdich, matured in bourbon casks and further maturation in Grenache wine casks. Released in 2007, this expression was the first edition of the Bruichladdich Rocks bottling series which began in 2007, with the final realise in 2011.

This 10 year old single malt is part of Macallan's Fine Oak, triple cask matured range. It has been matured for ten years in three oak cask types; Europen oak seasoned with sherry, American oak seasoned with sherry and American oak seasoned with bourbon. This bottling has been discontinued.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Orkney - Single Malt 2000 North Star 17 Year Old
DESCRIPTION:
North Star's Cask Series 3rd release was distilled at an unconfirmed Orkney distillery in 2000. It doesn't take a genius to figure out it is Scapa or Highland Park...but this expression was finished in an ex-Pedro Ximenez hogshead.
Bottled in September 2017 this is one of 366 bottles.

An older version of this bottle the Bruichladdich 15 Year Old.
This style of bottle is becoming harder and harder to find every year.

The Macallan Sherry Oak 12 Years Old forms part of the Sherry Oak range which features a series of single malt whiskies matured exclusively in hand-picked sherry seasoned oak casks from Jerez for richness and complexity.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: White Heather - 15 Year Old -De Luxe - Decanter (1980s)
DESCRIPTION: This is an increasingly rare bottle of White Heather 15 Year Old De Luxe blended Scotch whisky, produced by Aberlour Glenlivet Distillery, Clan Cambell Ltd, in the 1980s.

Highland Park, the most northern Scotch Whisky Distillery in Scotland have released this expression which is their most peated whisky thus far.
It is the final piece of the Highland Park Viking Legends trilogy puzzle.
The whisky was matured in refill casks.

This 12 year old single malt is part of Macallan's Fine Oak, triple cask matured range.  It has been matured for twelve years in three oak cask types; Europen oak seasoned with sherry, American oak seasoned with sherry and American oak seasoned with bourbon.  The Macallan Fine Oak 12 Year Old is medium-bodied and balanced with fruit, oak and spice.

Tusail is the sixth entry in Glenmorangie's Private Collection.  Made using traditionally floor-malted Maris Otter barley, this is an old-fashioned whisky backed up by Glenmorangie's modern approach to whisky-making.

One of 300 bottles and distilled in May 2007, this 8 year old is actually a highland malt due to its location.
It was commissioned for the 2016 Spirit of Speyside festival and bottled in March of that year.

Ardbeg Ten Year Old is known around the world as the peatiest, smokiest, most complex single malt of them all. Yet it does not flaunt the peat; rather it gives way to the natural sweetness of the malt to produce a whisky of perfect balance. Named World Whisky of the Year in 2008.
Produced on the Kildalton Coast of Islay, this single malt matures for a decade before being bottled without any chill-filtration with a strength of 46% ABV.
Comes with an Ardbeg branded tasting glass.

This a 1-litre bottling of Laphroaig Triple wood.  It was originally launched for the duty-free market but the Triple Wood has become a core expression from Laphroaig.  The single malt has been triple matured; in bourbon barrels, quarter casks and then Oloroso sherry butts.
A 21-year-old blended scotch from Ballantine’s: sophisticated, well-balanced and exceptionally aromatic.

Full Volume by Highland Park was distilled in 1999 and bottled in 2017 from 481 casks.  The single malt was matured exclusively in first-fill bourbon casks and was bottled at 47.2% ABV and comes presented in a themed presentation box resembling speaker.
This is a premium Dewar's blend produced by John Dewar & Sons. Each and every bottle of Dewar's Signature is individually numbered and marked with the signature of the brand founder.

A 12 year old Glenfiddich with a twist - the malted barley is dried using peat to produce a more characterful, smoky flavour - its name “Caoran” is from the Gaelic for Peat Ember.  Although a resounding success since its launch, this is a discontinued bottling.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Skara Brae - 12 Year Old - 2005 (cask 20) - The Cooper's Choice
BOTTLER: The Vintage Malt Whisky Co. Ltd
DESCRIPTION: Skara Brae is a 12 year old single malt from a mystery distillery on Orkney, drawn from single bourbon cask #20 following a 12-year maturation.  Distilled in June 2005 and bottled in 2017 by The Vintage Malt Whisky Co. for The Cooper's Choice range. The name 'Skara Brae' comes from a stone-built Neolithic settlement on the Bay of Skaill in Orkney. This is a limited release of just 450 bottles.

This 10 year old Scapa is part of the Distillery Reserve Collection from Chivas Brothers' single malt whisky.  This was distilled on 17th December 2008 and bottled from a single first fill barrel on the 29th of May 2019.  It was bottled at cask strenght at 55.4% abv.  
This is one of 348 bottles produced. This is a 50cl bottling.
This is bottle #147.

BOTTLER: The Vintage Malt Whisky Co. Ltd.
DESCRIPTION: This limited edition Finlaggan was released exclusively for the Fèis Ìle 2016. Distilled in 2006, this is one of just 350 bottles produced from a Hogshead. The Islay Whisky Shop in Shore Street, Bowmore is the only place in the world where people could buy a bottle.
Caol Ila Distillers Edition was laid down in 2004 and subsequently bottled in 2016 after many years maturation in oak casks then double-matured in dark Moscatel caskwood.

Introduced in 2012, Glengoyne 18 Year Old was revamped to replace the Glengoyne 17 Year Old. This Highland single malt was matured in a mix of refill sherry casks and a generous portion of first-fill sherry casks.

This malt is not only rare because of the number of bottles produced but because of the Bere Barley. It is rarely used but Bruichladdich has made an exception and used the grown crop grown at Kynagarry Farm on the Achaba and Achfad Fields.
 
This malt was distilled in 2006.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Bruichladdich - The Laddie Ten - Classic Ten
DESCRIPTION: This was the first release of a new series from Bruichladdich.  Laddie Classic is a no-age-statement bottling intended to show the classic 'Laddie style.
A rare higher-strength version of enduringly popular Johnnie Walker named after the way the bottle 'swings' back and forth.
This is an old and rare bottling of Glenmorangie 10 year old which comes with its original presentation tin.
An iconic old-style 50cl bottling of Glenmorangie 10 Year old with classic presentation tin.

Highland Park Dark Origins is core bottling that celebrates the early days of Magnus Eunson's illicit distilling on Orkney, back before the distillery was even founded in 1798. Magnus worked as a butcher and church official by day, but by night he was a legendary whisky smuggler and distiller outwitting the exciseman.
The single malt was matured in double first-fill sherry casks; 80% first-fill sherry casks (of which 60% is European oak and 20% American) and 20% refill sherry casks.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Macallan - Gold - Limited Edition with 2x Glasses
DESCRIPTION:
A stylish Macallan gift pack.  It contains a 70cl bottle of the Gold expression from the Macallan 1824 Series, and two limited-edition branded Macallan whisky tumblers. 
The Gold was introduced as an alternative to Macallan 10 Year Old Fine Oak is at the light end of the colour/flavour spectrum.

The Macallan Sherry Oak 12 Years Old forms part of the Sherry Oak range which features a series of single malt whiskies matured exclusively in hand-picked sherry seasoned oak casks from Jerez for richness and complexity.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Royal Lochnagar - 14 Year Old - Old Malt Cask
DESCRIPTION:
Bottled at cask strength for the Queen's Diamond Jubilee from Douglas Laing's / Hunter Laing's Old Malt Cask range.
Distilled in 1997 and bottled in Jan 2012 there were 676 bottles produced.
It came from a Sherry Butt with the DL Ref: 8017.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Chivas - Royal Salute - 21 Year Old - Sapphire Flagon
DESCRIPTION: This is a special Sapphire-coloured edition of Chivas' Royal Salute 21 Year Old blended whisky from the Chivas Royal Salute Range.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Chivas - Royal Salute - 21 Year Old - Ruby Flagon
DESCRIPTION: This is a special Ruby-coloured edition of Chivas' Royal Salute 21 Year Old blended whisky.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Chivas - Royal Salute - 21 Year Old - Ruby Flagon
DESCRIPTION: This is a special Ruby-coloured edition of Chivas' Royal Salute 21 Year Old blended whisky.

An Cladach by Bunnahabhain is a sherried expression. The name means 'The Shore' in Scots Gaelic which suits well due to Bunnahabhain's location on the north-east coast of Islay. This limited edition bottling was released for the Travel Retail market. This is a 1-litre bottling.

Glendronach 12  Year Old - Original was fully sherry matured in both Pedro Ximenez and Oloroso sherry casks.
This bottling is popular all over the world and probably one of the most highly regarded Glendronach core range malts there is.

Highland Park created THE DOLPHINS as an officially licenced product for sale in the bars and shops at the The Royal Navy’s Faslane base in Scotland.
The ‘Dolphins’ badge, featuring two dolphins and a crowned anchor, is awarded to British Submariners on successful completion of what is regarded as one of the toughest courses in the world – the Submarine Command Course,aptly known as ‘Perisher’.
The elegant matte black bottle is designed to evoke the hull of a Submarine and the release is rumoured to be limited to 1500 bottles.

Due to popular demand, Glengoyne brought out the 20cl versions of their bottlings. This 20cl bottling is an excellent way to sample their 21 year old that Won a Gold Medal at the San Francisco World Spirits Competition 2005.  The highland malt was matured in hand-selected sherry casks.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Teeling - Baltic Porter Cask Finish - Genys Brewery
DESCRIPTION: A special edition Teeling Small Batch that has been finished in Baltic Porter casks from the Genys Brewing Co. Bottle.

Bowmore Black Rock was released for the travel retail market in 2014. This is a no-age Statement whisky that was matured predominantly in Spanish ex-sherry casks, this shows an excellent balance between richness and smoke.

This 12 year old single malt is part of Macallan's Fine Oak, triple cask matured range.  It has been matured for twelve years in three oak cask types; Europen oak seasoned with sherry, American oak seasoned with sherry and American oak seasoned with bourbon.  The Macallan Fine Oak 12 Year Old is medium-bodied and balanced with fruit, oak and spice.
A very old and rare bottle of rum from the 1970s. Produced in Barbados, Guyana, Jamaica and Trinidad.

Highland Park created THE DOLPHINS as an officially licenced product for sale in the bars and shops at the The Royal Navy’s Faslane base in Scotland.
The ‘Dolphins’ badge, featuring two dolphins and a crowned anchor, is awarded to British Submariners on successful completion of what is regarded as one of the toughest courses in the world – the Submarine Command Course,aptly known as ‘Perisher’.
The elegant matte black bottle is designed to evoke the hull of a Submarine and the release is rumoured to be limited to 1500 bottles.

Grown on one farm on the beautiful Island of the peat monsters, comes the Islay Barley collection from Bruichladdich.
This bottling used barley which was grown from Dunlossit Farm and distilled in 2006.
This bottle has been signed by A. Logan.
This Glenrothes single malt was distilled in 1994 and bottled in 2008. This bottling was checked by Max McFarlane and approved by John Ramsay on 11th April 2006.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glenfiddich - 18 Year Old - Small Batch Reserve
DESCRIPTION: Matured in small batches the Glenfiddich 18 is arguably the most complex in the core range.  the single malt has been matured in oloroso sherry and bourbon casks.  It is very fragrant with tropical fruit and sherry cask influences, rich baked apple and cinnamon spice compliments by robust oak notes.
This is a litre bottling of Famous Grouse - 1992 Vintage, which was relased following the success of the 1989 vintage. This vatted malt from Famous Grouse includes Highland Park and Macallan.

Originally released for the Travel Retail market this non age statement whisky has Sherry-cask-matured single malt at its core.
It is named for the famous draggon longship which the Vikings used to travel in to colonise the islands in the 8th century.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glenfiddich - Special Old Reserve - Clan Sutherland - 1990s
DESCRIPTION: A Glenfiddich Clans of the Highlands bottling from around the 1990s which celebrates one of seven of Scotland's most powerful clans. This release celebrates the history of Clan Sutherland. The tin features a painting of Kenneth Sutherland, 3rd Lord Duffus.

The story behind this bottle is both historic for the bottle and for the town that surrounds the distillery.
1785 saw a tragic accident involving a hot air balloon. The bursting of flames was symbolic of a Pheonix rising and it made such an impact that even the coat of arms from the town bears this majestic bird.
This was a limited edition release for the travel retail market.
Bottle number 104 of 2014.

Highland Park Dark Origins is core bottling that celebrates the early days of Magnus Eunson's illicit distilling on Orkney, back before the distillery was even founded in 1798. Magnus worked as a butcher and church official by day, but by night he was a legendary whisky smuggler and distiller outwitting the exciseman.
The single malt was matured in double first-fill sherry casks; 80% first-fill sherry casks (of which 60% is European oak and 20% American) and 20% refill sherry casks.

Aberlour Casg Annamh - 'Rare Cask' in Gaelic -  sherried release from Aberlour, Triple matured in European oak ex-sherry, American oak ex-sherry and ex-bourbon casks, this is a bold, flavoursome and exceptionally balanced whisky. It is non chill-filtered and produced in small batches - this bottling is part of Batch 2.

This 12 year old single malt is part of Macallan's Fine Oak, triple cask matured range.  It has been matured for twelve years in three oak cask types; Europen oak seasoned with sherry, American oak seasoned with sherry and American oak seasoned with bourbon.  The Macallan Fine Oak 12 Year Old is medium-bodied and balanced with fruit, oak and spice.

This 1970s bottle from the Tomintoul (Glenlivet) distillery is an unusual shape.  It features a round, grooved/fluted glass and a large silver screwtop - often referred to as a perfume bottle style. Very different from the traditional bottleneck.
This special bottling of Dalmore 12 Year Old was bottled on 15 October 2001 to thank the staff and celebrate the creation of Kyndal, which is now known as Whyte & Mackay.
This gift pack includes 3 x 35cl bottlings:

This is part of Ardbeg's core malt range which also includes the 10-year-old & Uigeadail as well as An Oa.  Named after a whirlpool close to Ardbeg distillery, Corryvreckan is an intense dram that has risen in popularity.

Legacy, the classic blended whisky from historic brand Something Special.
The malt component is mostly from Speyside.

Ballantine's is a premium blend and this is one of their best.
A well-aged blended malt is in a beautiful decanter.
Aged 21 Years.
Traditional Oak Cask, a core bottling by Benrmoach, with 80% of casks were bourbon-matured and the remaining 20% matured in sherry casks.
This 10 year old is from Tobermory Distillery on the Isle of Mull.  This is a more gentle medium-bodied, accessible malt than the peated whisky they produce (which is marketed as Ledaig).
Tamdhu 10 Year Old is the first release in their maturing range of whiskies. Matured exclusively in sherry oak casks for 10 long years gives this Tamdhu bottling its glorious natural colour.

A special release for the new Millennium.
This was commissioned for Royal Mile Whiskies, Edinburgh.
360 bottles were produced of this 10-year-old in 1999.
This is bottle number 95/360.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Lagavulin - 9 Year Old - Game of Thrones - House Lannister
DESCRIPTION:
To celebrate the eighth and final season of Game of Thrones, Diageo collaborated with HBO to release a limited-edition collection of eight single malt Scotch whiskies inspired by each of the Houses of Westeros and the Night's Watch.
This 9-year-old Islay single malt from Lagavulin represents the House Lannister - one of the richest and oldest dynasties in the Seven Kingdoms. This 9 year old was matured exclusively in first-fill ex-bourbon casks.

The Triple Cask expression from Aberlour is a non-age statement bottling made up from a combination of whisky from three varieties of cask - bourbon barrels, bourbon hogsheads and Oloroso sherry casks.

A beautifully designed well-aged statement whisky from the Speyside giant.
Even Tony Soprano would tell you this is a cracking dram, it was one of his favourites. 
Glenlivet is the oldest legal distillery in Scotland.

A beautifully designed well-aged statement whisky from the Speyside giant.
Even Tony Soprano would tell you this is a cracking dram, it was one of his favourites. 
Glenlivet is the oldest legal distillery in Scotland.

Auchroisk Distillery is located in Banffshire Scotland - in the Speyside region.
'The Singleton' from Auchroisk Distillery is a 10 Year Old whisky that won multiple gold awards between 1989 and 1994.

A beautifully designed well-aged statement whisky from the Speyside giant.
Even Tony Soprano would tell you this is a cracking dram, it was one of his favourites. 
Glenlivet is the oldest legal distillery in Scotland.
This is a litre bottling of Famous Grouse - 1992 Vintage, which was relased following the success of the 1989 vintage. This vatted malt from Famous Grouse includes Highland Park and Macallan.

Aberlour Casg Annamh - 'Rare Cask' in Gaelic -  sherried release from Aberlour, Triple matured in European oak ex-sherry, American oak ex-sherry and ex-bourbon casks, this is a bold, flavoursome and exceptionally balanced whisky. It is non chill-filtered and produced in small batches - this bottling is part of Batch 2.
This 10 year old Islay single malt from Bruichladdich comes complete with old style presentation tin tube.  This has now been replaced by 'Laddie Ten'.

Aberlour Casg Annamh - 'Rare Cask' in Gaelic -  sherried release from Aberlour, Triple matured in European oak ex-sherry, American oak ex-sherry and ex-bourbon casks, this is a bold, flavoursome and exceptionally balanced whisky. It is non chill-filtered and produced in small batches - this bottling is part of Batch 2.
This is an older style of 10 year old Lowland single malt distilled at Auchentoshan was bottled in the 1980s. It was triple-distilled and aged in oak casks. This is a 75cl bottling.

This is an earlier release of Dalmore 12 Year Old - it has aged for 9 years in American white oak ex-bourbon casks, then in ex-oloroso sherry casks for the final three years. The result is a whisky with a combination of sweetness and rich, sherried flavours.
"With its intricate aromas and flavours, The Dalmore 12 is recognised as a whisky with character far beyond its age" - Richard Patterson.
The Teeling Whisky Co. have collaborated with the Galway Bay Brewery to create this Irish whiskey finished in stout casks.

'Organic' was released as part of Bruichladdich's Futures collection.  The single malt was distilled in December 2003 using Maris Otter barley and aged in bourbon casks for 7 years until April 2011. This is an individually numbered bottle.

The first edition from Bruichladdich named "Scottish Barley" and tied in with the Classic Laddie.
Bottled at 50% this Islay dram will certainly take you by surprise.

This bottling showcase the very first time Port Charlotte has been distilled exclusively from 100% Islay barley. Grown on six farms across Bruichladdich’s wild, Hebridean island – Coull, Kynagarry, Island, Rockside, Strachmill and Sunderland, the Port Charlotte Islay Barley is a heavily peated Bruichladdich at 40 ppm.  It has also been bottled using Islay spring water from the Octomore field of farmer James Brown.

Highland Park created THE DOLPHINS as an officially licenced product for sale in the bars and shops at the The Royal Navy’s Faslane base in Scotland.
The ‘Dolphins’ badge, featuring two dolphins and a crowned anchor, is awarded to British Submariners on successful completion of what is regarded as one of the toughest courses in the world – the Submarine Command Course,aptly known as ‘Perisher’.
The elegant matte black bottle is designed to evoke the hull of a Submarine and the release is rumoured to be limited to 1500 bottles.

Highland Park created THE DOLPHINS as an officially licenced product for sale in the bars and shops at the The Royal Navy’s Faslane base in Scotland.
The ‘Dolphins’ badge, featuring two dolphins and a crowned anchor, is awarded to British Submariners on successful completion of what is regarded as one of the toughest courses in the world – the Submarine Command Course,aptly known as ‘Perisher’.
The elegant matte black bottle is designed to evoke the hull of a Submarine and the release is rumoured to be limited to 1500 bottles.

A combination of Sherry seasoned American oak and European oak casks was used to mature this single malt.  It is part of the Warrier Series by Highland Park which was created exclusively for Duty-Free.  
This edition is named after one of the most important figures in the history of the Vikings, Harald - was central to the founding of the Orkney Earldom.

A multi-vintage Bruichladdich, matured in bourbon casks and further maturation in Grenache wine casks. Released in 2011, this expression is the third and final edition of the Bruichladdich Rocks bottling series which began in 2007 - this lot comes with a Bruichladdich glass.

Glenmorangie Lasanta has now been created with an age statement of 12 years old. The single malt was finished in both oloroso and Pedro Ximenez sherry casks. 'Lasanta' is said to mean 'warmth and passion' in Gaelic.
This was the first release of a new series from Bruichladdich.  Laddie Classic is a no-age-statement bottling intended to show the classic 'Laddie style.
This was the first release of a new series from Bruichladdich.  Laddie Classic is a no-age-statement bottling intended to show the classic 'Laddie style.

This is an old presentation of the unpeated of the 10 year old from Tobermory Distillery on the Isle of Mull. This is a more gentle medium-bodied, accessible malt than the peated whisky they produce (which is marketed as Ledaig).

A 70cl of the medicinal 10 year old from Islay's bestselling distillery, Laphroaig.  In making Laphroaig, malted barley is dried over a peat fire.  The smoke from this peat, found only on Islay, gives Laphroaig its particularly rich flavour.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Johhnie Walker - 18 Year old - Gold Label
DESCRIPTION:
Owned by Diageo, the company was originally formed in Kilmarnock.
The bonded warehouse was located here for many years and is still the largest distributor of blended whisky in the world.
Annual sales have reached 226.2 million bottles in 2015.
This 18 year old is part of the Gold Label line.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Clynelish - House of Tyrell - Game of Thrones
DESCRIPTION:
The Clynelish Reserve 'House Tyrell' is one of 8 limited edition bottlings from Diageo's 2018 collaboration with HBO, from their collection of Game of Thrones malts.
House Tyrell of Highgarden, rulers of the Reach, are used to lush green scenery, echoed in the green pastures and rolling hills surrounding Clynelish Distillery.  A House known best for their wealth and their emblem – the golden rose – the Tyrells are a proud and noble family, and like the golden rose are hiding thorns beneath their petals. Made with water said to come from Clynemilton burn where the water runs over veins of gold in the rock, this single malt is light and floral like Highgarden, but should not be underestimated as it still holds a strong Highland character.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Teacher's - 18 Year Old Highland Cream - Limited Edition
DESCRIPTION:
Teacher's Highland Cream Scotch Whisky.
A real blast from the past. This limited edition contains at least 45% of pure malt whiskies.
They believed this would guarantee the future of the blend.
This is an older style 12-year-old,  bottled in the 1980s by Glenturret.  This entry-level bottling was discontinued in 2003, when it was replaced by the 10 year-old.
Robbie Burns Blend from the 1970s.

This is part of Ardbeg's core malt range which also includes the 10-year-old & Uigeadail as well as An Oa.  Named after a whirlpool close to Ardbeg distillery, Corryvreckan is an intense dram that has risen in popularity.

Made from barley harvested at Rockside Farm, Islay, in 2006 and distilled in 2007. The specially selected grain, the slow distillation and carefully considered casks were vital in creating this iconic unpeated single malt.

BOTTLER: The Vintage Malt Whisky Co. Ltd.
DESCRIPTION: This limited edition French Oak matured Finlaggan was released exclusively for the Fèis Ìle2019. Created from a vatting of 2 red wine casks, then bottled at 52% vol. The Islay Whisky Shop in Shore Street, Bowmore is the only place in the world where people could buy a bottle.
This was the first release of a new series from Bruichladdich.  Laddie Classic is a no-age-statement bottling intended to show the classic 'Laddie style.

Highland Park created THE DOLPHINS as an officially licenced product for sale in the bars and shops at the The Royal Navy’s Faslane base in Scotland.
The ‘Dolphins’ badge, featuring two dolphins and a crowned anchor, is awarded to British Submariners on successful completion of what is regarded as one of the toughest courses in the world – the Submarine Command Course,aptly known as ‘Perisher’.
The elegant matte black bottle is designed to evoke the hull of a Submarine and the release is rumoured to be limited to 1500 bottles.

A 15 Year Old Glenfiddich from the Speyside region married together with a solera vat. 
Glenfiddich is one of the world's best-selling single-malt whiskies.

BOTTLER: The Vintage Malt Whisky Co. Ltd.
DESCRIPTION: This limited edition French Oak matured Finlaggan was released exclusively for the Fèis Ìle 2018. Distilled in 2009 and bottled in 2018 at 50% ABV.  This is one of 700 bottles. The Islay Whisky Shop in Shore Street, Bowmore is the only place in the world where people could buy a bottle.

Bottled at the cask strength of 54.2, this limited edition Ardbeg was created from a marriage of single malt from bourbon barrels and sherry butts.  This gives a sweet and smoky finish.  It is named after the Loch that all the Ardbeg water flows from.  This Ardbeg is often said to be the best value in the Ardbeg core range, following the demise of Airigh nam Beist.

Another superb cask-finished whisky from Glenmorangie as part of their Legends range, this time using Amontillado sherry casks. This offering was previously only available at travel retail, though luckily a few bottles have made it onto our shelves. Glenmorangie the Tayne takes its inspiration from the legend of a Spanish man-o’-war ship that was wrecked off the coast close to the distillery. The whisky seeks to recreate the profile of a “Spanish treasure”. This whisky takes Glenmorangie’s classic floral, biscuity flavours, and adds another layer of sherried complexity. Amontillado is a type of sherry typified as being darker than Fino but lighter than Oloroso, with an excellent balance between the dry and sweet characteristics of both sherries.
It was, of course, immortalised by Edgar Allen Poe in his classic gothic short story, The Cask of Amontillado. There are no horror stories here however, with Glenmorangie the Tayne being a superb whisky, with excellent, sophisticated flavours of dry wine, almonds and honey. This whisky is bottled at 43%, and in a litre size.

The finest old Scottish Whisky was distilled in medieval Scottish Monasteries and carried out in the traditional way.
Please note general wear to the packaging.

This 2008 vintage Benromach was bottled in 2019 after a decade maturing in first-fill bourbon and sherry casks. This delicately smoky dram is said to be replacing 100° Proof in the Bemromach Classic Range.

Hakushu Distiller's Reserve single malt whisky is a no-age-statement expression, that captures the smoky, herbaceous characteristics of their whiskies. This was one of two Spring 2014 release from Suntory.

Bottled for the Bay in this bottle celebrates the 70th Anniversary of the Royal Air Force Battle of Britain.
100% Scotch whisky blend.

A multi-vintage Bruichladdich, matured in bourbon casks and further maturation in Grenache wine casks. Released in 2011, this expression is the third and final edition of the Bruichladdich Rocks bottling series which began in 2007 - this lot comes with a Bruichladdich glass.

Bottled at the cask strength of 54.2, this limited edition Ardbeg was created from a marriage of single malt from bourbon barrels and sherry butts.  This gives a sweet and smoky finish.  It is named after the Loch that all the Ardbeg water flows from.  This Ardbeg is often said to be the best value in the Ardbeg core range, following the demise of Airigh nam Beist.
This is a 12 year old single malt from Royal Lochnagar Distillery. It is of the three distilleries in Scotland ever to be granted the title of 'Royal' in front of their name.

This is an old presentation of the unpeated of the 10 year old from Tobermory Distillery on the Isle of Mull. This is a more gentle medium-bodied, accessible malt than the peated whisky they produce (which is marketed as Ledaig).

This 10 year old would be somewhat classed as the older Glenkinchie. It was replaced by the 12 year old.
A lowland malt that was established in 1837.
This malt has a delicate nose with a clean and fresh aftertaste.
This release was the 5th official bottling from Kilchoman Distillery.  This single mat was matured in bourbon casks for 3 years and production was limited to 15,850 bottles.

Old Pulteney 12 year old whisky has won many awards. It boasts lingering sea tastes with a sweetness.
This is an older bottle from the late 1990s.

Moch is Gaelic for 'dawn' - it is a much lighter expression than their 12 year old.
Caol Ila Moch is the first single malt from the distillery to be selected entirely on the basis of its taste, rather than age, cask wood, strength or finish.

Highland Park created THE DOLPHINS as an officially licenced product for sale in the bars and shops at the The Royal Navy’s Faslane base in Scotland.
The ‘Dolphins’ badge, featuring two dolphins and a crowned anchor, is awarded to British Submariners on successful completion of what is regarded as one of the toughest courses in the world – the Submarine Command Course,aptly known as ‘Perisher’.
The elegant matte black bottle is designed to evoke the hull of a Submarine and the release is rumoured to be limited to 1500 bottles.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 12 Year Old  - Orkneyinga Legacy
DESCRIPTION:
This is a 12 year old special edition release from Highland Park.  It was bottled at its marrying strength of 46% ABV to intensify the whisky’s distinctive flavours of honey, fruitcake and warm winter spices. 
It is named in honor of The Orkneyinga Saga – also known as The History of the Earls of Orkney. It’s the only medieval chronicle in which Orkney takes centre stage and is a fascinating and bloodthirsty read!

This is a popular and much sought-after single malt with the massive peat-smoke that's typical of southern Islay - but also offering richness and a dryness that turns it into a truly interesting tipple. The 16 year old, aged in oak casks has truly become a benchmark Islay dram from the Lagavulin distillery.
This whisky was The Runner Up in TWE's Whisky of the Year 2014 & 2015 Silver Outstanding Medal Winner - International Wine & Spirits Competition amongst other accolades.

A classic 70cl  bottling of the medicinal 10 year old from Islay's bestselling distillery, Laphroaig.  In making Laphroaig, malted barley is dried over a peat fire.  The smoke from this peat, found only on Islay, gives Laphroaig its particularly rich flavour.

Released as part of the Glenlivet Nadurra range, this single malt was fully matured in first-fill Oloroso sherry casks.  Every release in this series was bottled and released in small batches - this is batch #OL1017 was bottled in October 2017. This is a 1L bottling.

This is an older style bottling of the popular dram, known as 'The single malt that started it all' for Glenlivet.  The Glenlivet 12 Year Old has a soft smooth balance of sweet summer fruits and the floral notes of spring flowers. This is a 1-litre bottling.

The new 10-year-old single malt has replaced this bottling by Tamdhu distillery since the take over by Ian Macleod Distillers.
The malt is said to be slightly and being from Speyside it may seem strange but it certainly works on this occasion.
This blended malt was bottled by Gordon & MacPhail.
A highly collectable bottle of Bunnahabhain 12 year old single malt. This an older style bottling.

This Mackinlay whisky decanter is the shape of a rugby ball to celebrate the Rugby World Cup in 1991.  This commemorative special edition piece this is a very rare - this is one of only 250 produced.
This is number 32.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Orkney Gin Company - Johannistag Navy Strength Old Tom
DESCRIPTION:
This gin mioxes two gin styles of Old Tom and Navy Strength. Johannistag Navy Strength Old Tom Gin from Orkney Gin Company is a limited edition gin that was released in two batches of 500, with two different bottle designs. This special edition Navy Old Tom Gin was released to commemorate the centenary of the Scuttling of the German High Seas Fleet in Orkney’s Scapa Flow. Distilled using honey, heather and rose petals, the botanicals were selected to reflect Orkney’s summer months.
This is bottle number 174.

'An Oa' was the first addition to Ardbeg's core range for a decade when introduced in 2017.  It is made up from a combination of spirit aged in Pedro-Ximenez sherry casks and bourbon barrels. Married in a French-oak marrying vat, this is rounded and smoky with notes of toffee, aniseed, date and banana.

This lot includes 2 x 75cl bottles.
Dewars White Label is a classic blend that is popular all over the globe. 
These bottle are from the 1970's and are Spanish imports.

'An Oa' was the first addition to Ardbeg's core range for a decade when introduced in 2017.  It is made up from a combination of spirit aged in Pedro-Ximenez sherry casks and bourbon barrels. Married in a French-oak marrying vat, this is rounded and smoky with notes of toffee, aniseed, date and banana.

Part of the so-called Legends Collection, this Glenmorangie Duthac is composed of whisky finished in PX sherry and charred virgin oak casks. Rich and mellow, with just enough sweetness from the sherry influence, it’s best sampled with a little water to unearth the chocolate and butterscotch.
This 10 Year Old Arran single malt is part of their core range. Bottled unchillfiltered at 46%.

Highland Park created THE DOLPHINS as an officially licenced product for sale in the bars and shops at the The Royal Navy’s Faslane base in Scotland.
The ‘Dolphins’ badge, featuring two dolphins and a crowned anchor, is awarded to British Submariners on successful completion of what is regarded as one of the toughest courses in the world – the Submarine Command Course,aptly known as ‘Perisher’.
The elegant matte black bottle is designed to evoke the hull of a Submarine and the release is rumoured to be limited to 1500 bottles.
A mixture of single and grain whisky. Very much underrated for this well-aged expression from James Buchanan Glasgow.

A special edition blended whisky from Hiram Walker to commemorate Alistair Cunningham's 50th year with the company in 1995. It's not a 50 year old whisky, but instead a blend of 50 malt whiskies and grain from Dumbarton.  This is a 75cl bottling.
This 10 Year Old Bunnahabhain was bottled by Gordon & MacPhail as part of their Discovery range.

A younger, lively Laphroaig that has had the maturation process speeded up by ageing in quarter casks.  As the size of the cask is smaller the maturation doesn't need to be as long. This process has created a soft sweetness and a velvety feel when first tasted, then the intense peatiness so unique to Laphroaig comes bursting through.

Bottled by Ian Macleod this Ardbeg was part of their Cheiftan's range.
Cask numbers include 1037/1039, 1053/1062, 1960/1961 and 1972/1973.
It was bottled in 2009 and distilled in July 1998.
There were 5076 bottles produced.

'An Oa' was the first addition to Ardbeg's core range for a decade when introduced in 2017.  It is made up from a combination of spirit aged in Pedro-Ximenez sherry casks and bourbon barrels. Married in a French-oak marrying vat, this is rounded and smoky with notes of toffee, aniseed, date and banana.
Only whiskies aged for 19 years or more have been blended to create this Imperial whisky.  It is characterised by a smoothness and a gentle sweet, floral aroma.

A beautifully presented three pack of Dewar's in a leather case. 
18 Year Old, 12 Year Old & Signature.

A younger, lively Laphroaig that has had the maturation process speeded up by ageing in quarter casks.  As the size of the cask is smaller the maturation doesn't need to be as long. This process has created a soft sweetness and a velvety feel when first tasted, then the intense peatiness so unique to Laphroaig comes bursting through.

A lightly peated single malt made up of different ages.  It is named after the fact that Islanders were very superstitious in the past, this is a nod to them, and to the Island of Jura which is still dotted with ancient stones and markings.  When you raise a glass of this whisky, you're raising a glass to the ancient ways of the island.

This is an eagerly anticpiated first core product from Kilkerran – The Kilkerran 12 Year Old is lightly peated and non-chill filtered, and has been matured in a combination of 70% bourbon casks and 30% Sherry casks.  The distillery was reopened in 2004 after being closed for almost 80 years.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Arran - The Bothy - Quarter Cask-  Batch #4
DESCRIPTION: Released in 2018, this is the fourth edition in The Arran distillery’s The Bothy Quarter Cask series, this whisky has been aged in ex-bourbon barrels and finished for 18 months in American oak quarter casks, allowing extra interaction with the wood and unturn increasing the flavour. This is one of 13,800 bottles.

This 13-year-old single malt comes from the relatively unknown distillery in the Speyside region of Scotland.
Using old fashioned techniques "worm tubs' to cool the spirit and bestow it with extra flavour, which will give it the ability to rival whiskies that are tice this malts age.

This is a great single pot still whiskey that has been matured in a combination of bourbon and sherry casks, creating a sweet-and-spicy character. Redbreast 12 Year Old was impressively named 'Overall Irish Whiskey of the Year' at the 2013 Irish Whiskey Awards.
An older style Aberlour 10 years old, bottled at 43% in the early 1980s.

This is the Western Highland representative in Diageo's 'Classic Malt' series. Oban 14 year old single malt is a rich and fruity malt, with notes of heather and smoke.  It an award-winning single malt, distilled close to the sea.

A distillery owned by the spirits giant Diageo, Cragganmore is one of their Speyside malts that more than holds its own year on year.
Haven't tried it and like a smooth Speyside? This is your bottle!
This is a 75cl bottling.

11 different tin designs were produced by Glenfiddich, each one represents a different famous Scottish clan. 
Within each tin a bottle of Glenfiddich Special Old Reserve awaits.

This Glenfiddich 15-Year-Old Solera is matured in a combination of Bourbon, Sherry and Virgin Oak casks then married together in a handcrafted  Oregon pine Solera vat.  This bottling has won multiple awards.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 10 Year Old - Rebus 30 Rankin
DESCRIPTION: Released in June 2017, REBUS30 10 Year Old marks the 30th anniversary of the publication of the first ‘Inspector Rebus’ novel, Knots & Crosses.  John Rebus, the creation of best-selling crime writer Ian Rankin, is now one of the most iconic figures of modern crime fiction.

Cardhu 12 year old single malt whisky from Speyside, Scotland. This single malt was purely produced at the distillery in Morayshire, Scotland. Although recognised as a Speyside whisky, they actually advertise being Highland Scotch Whisky.

Part of a Glenfiddich's Casks Collection, Select Cask has been matured in a combination of European oak, ex-bourbon and ex-red-wine casks specially selected by malt master Brian Kinsman. It was then married in a solera vat. This is a 1 litre bottling.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - Magnus US Exclusive (5 x 5cl)
DESCRIPTION:
Magnus single malt whisky was matured in Sherry seasoned American oak casks. The release was named after Magnus Eunson, Highland Park Founder who was a direct descendant of the Vikings that settled on Orkney hundreds of years ago. 
This lot contains 5 x 5cl miniature bottles of Highland Park Magnus.
This is a 12 year old single malt from Royal Lochnagar Distillery. It is of the three distilleries in Scotland ever to be granted the title of 'Royal' in front of their name.
From 2017 this slightly higher % from their core range represents the Orkney distillery in a great fashion.   Very rich and on the smokier side for Highland Park.

An older version of the 12 year old from Pulteney distillery.  Matured only in air-dried, hand-selected ex-bourbon casks, Old Pulteney 12 year old whisky has won many awards. It boasts lingering sea tastes with a sweetness.

Ardbeg Supernova SN2014 is one of the peatiest (110ppm) and explosively flavoured Ardbegs ever.  This limited edition Committee Release celebrates the incredible story that Ardbeg successfully launched whisky into space and it returned.

A younger, lively Laphroaig that has had the maturation process speeded up by ageing in quarter casks.  As the size of the cask is smaller the maturation doesn't need to be as long. This process has created a soft sweetness and a velvety feel when first tasted, then the intense peatiness so unique to Laphroaig comes bursting through.
An older release of 10 Year Old from Talisker distillery on the Isle of Skye.  Aged for a minimum of 10 years in American oak casks.

After 14 years maturing in fine American oak casks, the Glenfiddich Malt Master carefully selected virgin Spanish and American oak casks to release extra layers of aroma and flavour.  This is said to be the first virgin American and European oak finished whisky in the world.

This limited edition Talisker 10-Year-Old is comes in a special box for the Royal National Lifeboat Institute.  It was originally released by Talisker to raise money for the RNLI - £1 from the original sale was donated.
An older release of 10 Year Old from Talisker distillery on the Isle of Skye.  Aged for a minimum of 10 years in American oak casks.
This whisky was selected and sold by the Scottish Parliament.

The 12 year old Singleton of Dufftown is a combination of American and European Oak casks.  It is one of three Singleton whiskies produced by Diageo - the other releases in the series are Glen Ord and Glendullan.

A 70cl of the medicinal 10 year old from Islay's bestselling distillery, Laphroaig.  In making Laphroaig, malted barley is dried over a peat fire.  The smoke from this peat, found only on Islay, gives Laphroaig its particularly rich flavour.
Tomatin 10 Year Old bottled in the 1990's as you can see by the old-style label.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Old Pulteney - 12 Year Old - P&O 175th Anniversary
DESCRIPTION:
Released in 2012, this is a limited-edition gift pack released for P&O Ferries 175th anniversary celebrations. It featuring a 12 year old single malt specially selected by Old Pulteney Distillery Manager Malcolm.
P&O Cruises date back to 1837 when the company's founding fathers, Arthur Anderson and Brodie McGhie Willcox, were awarded the British Government contract for a weekly mail service to the Iberian Peninsula.

Grand 15 was produced at Glenmorangie Distillery which was owned by MacDonald and Muir at the time, this blended whisky is said to be still being produced today by different owners at Glenmorangie.
This bottle is from the 1970s.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Famous Grouse - 15 Year Old - World Rugby Select XV
DESCRIPTION:
"My famous XV commemorates the very best in world rugby".
Matured in Oak casks from all around Scotland comes Bill Mclaren's famous XV Rugby world cup selection.

Matured in first refill American oak and the last year in French oak.
The whisky is said to have a complex nature and bursting with fruitiness finishing with hints of vanilla.
This is bottle number 727.

WM. Cadenhead bottled this Auchentoshan at part of their Duthies collection.
19 years were spent maturing in an oak cask and as per Cadenheads rules, no colourings were used in the bottling of this pure malt.

A 70cl of the medicinal 10 year old from Islay's bestselling distillery, Laphroaig.  In making Laphroaig, malted barley is dried over a peat fire.  The smoke from this peat, found only on Islay, gives Laphroaig its particularly rich flavour.
A 10 year old distilled and bottled by Aberlour Glenlivet Distillery.  It has been matured in sherry and bourbon casks.
A rare higher-strength version of enduringly popular Johnnie Walker named after the way the bottle 'swings' back and forth.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Glenlivet - Master Distiller's Reserve - Small Batch (1L)
DESCRIPTION: Master Distiller's Reserve Small Batch from Glenlivet is made with specially selected casks, including first-fill ex-Sherry casks, first-fill American oak casks and traditional oak casks. It was originally released for the Travel Retail market.

Released to honour Alan Winchester, Master Distiller at the Glenlivet distillery since 2009. This whisky was matured in European oak butts and first-fill American barrels as well as refill hogsheads. It was originally released for the travel retail market.

Valkyrie is the first of Highland Park’s new Viking Legend series.  Valknut & Valhalla are the other releases in this series. 
Matured in a combination of first-fill American oak sherry, Bourbon and Spanish oak sherry casks and some refill casks. The packaging design was created by Danish designer Jim Lyngvild with inspiration drawn from the ancient Hammer Stone of Gotland and a Viking pendant from Upland, Sweden.
This single malt was awarded The Chairman’s Trophy in the 2017 Ultimate Spirits Challenge, scoring 99 out of 100.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Highland Park - 10 Year Old - Rebus 30 Rankin
DESCRIPTION: Released in June 2017, REBUS30 10 Year Old marks the 30th anniversary of the publication of the first ‘Inspector Rebus’ novel, Knots & Crosses.  John Rebus, the creation of best-selling crime writer Ian Rankin, is now one of the most iconic figures of modern crime fiction.
Produced by John McEwan & Co and old bottling which would have been released in the 1970's.

A younger, lively Laphroaig that has had the maturation process speeded up by ageing in quarter casks.  As the size of the cask is smaller the maturation doesn't need to be as long. This process has created a soft sweetness and a velvety feel when first tasted, then the intense peatiness so unique to Laphroaig comes bursting through.

A 70cl of the medicinal 10 year old from Islay's bestselling distillery, Laphroaig.  In making Laphroaig, malted barley is dried over a peat fire.  The smoke from this peat, found only on Islay, gives Laphroaig its particularly rich flavour.

This 15 year old from the Dalwhinnie distillery is part of Diageo's Classic Malts range.  Jim Murray awarded this 15 year old 95 points in the Whisky Bible, recognising the quality of the dram for the price.

A lovely old-style bottle of Caol Ila 12.
You would usually find this bottle being exported, however, this is one of the originals that stayed on home soil.
Caol Ila is currently undergoing mass reconstruction and should be ready in 2020.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Allied Distillers - Queen's Award Miniature Set (10 x 5cl)
DESCRIPTION: Allied Distillers Queen's Award Miniature Selection - this set includes 10 x 5cl:

A distillery owned by the spirits giant Diageo, Cragganmore is one of their Speyside malts that more than holds its own year on year.
Haven't tried it and like a smooth Speyside? This is your bottle!
A 1980s bottling of Bushmills 10 Year Old triple distilled Single Malt Irish Whiskey - this is a very collectable bottling.

Kilchoman's Machir Bay matured in ex-bourbon barrels and Oloroso Sherry butts.
Possibly one of the lesser known of the Islay malts but a real must try if you haven't already!

This is an older style bottling of Glengoyne 10 year old single malt.
This is a highland malt and somewhat of a favourite in the Asian market.

Bottled by the House of Greyhound, Edinburgh.
Since 1935 the Greyhound BRand has stood for the highest quality and is hugely proud of their scotch whisky. Said to be incredibly smooth it looks like they have continued their long tradition of excellence.

Produced at Cooley distillery this is an Irish whisky with lots of character.
Situated on the west coast of Ireland, it is said to be "one of natures masterpieces"
This expression has been matured in Oak casks using traditional distilling methods.

This 12-year-old Ballantine's blend is made of over forty malts from across Scotland, each allowed to mature for at least 12 years in oak casks.  Gold Seal is one of Ballantine's more premium releases.

A non-vintage from the Glenrothes distillery, selected by Glenrothes Distiller Jim Sutherland and Malt Master, John Ramsay.  The whisky was selected and vatted from casks from different years then married together in perfect harmony.  It has been produced to the same high-quality standards as The Glenrothes Vintage selections.

Highland Park 12 year old - one of the best malts in the world year on year. This bottling has been in its core range for over 100 years.
Michael Jackson, Malt Whisky Companion regards this whisky as "The greatest all-rounder in the world of malt whisky."

Skiren is known as the honeyed tropical one because of its smooth, creamy sweetness with a hint of tropical fruit, citrus and coastal heather. It was exclusively matured in 100% first-fill American Oak Casks, selected by Scapa artisans. This is batch 1 which was introduced into their range in 2015.  It is made up of whisky produced on the industry's only remaining Lomond Still.
'Skiren' - old Norse, glittering, bright skies.

Ardbeg Supernova SN2014 is one of the peatiest (110ppm) and explosively flavoured Ardbegs ever.  This limited edition Committee Release celebrates the incredible story that Ardbeg successfully launched whisky into space and it returned.
Chivas Brother 12 Year Old from the 1980s. One of the top three grossing whiskies sold year on year.

This Ballantine's 17 year old bottling is from the 1990s.  Matured in oak casks and bottled by Ballantine & Son Limited distillers. This bottling was released for the Asian market. This is a 50cl bottling.

Grand 15 was produced at Glenmorangie Distillery which was owned by MacDonald and Muir at the time, this blended whisky is said to be still being produced today by different owners at Glenmorangie.
This bottle is from the 1970s.

Part of the core range from Glenrothes.
This expression won the 2006 Gold medal at the San Francisco World Spirits Competition.

Bottled for the supermarket giant Tesco this Ardnave is 12 years old.
For those in the know...this is almost certainly from Bruichladdich.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: The Singleton of Dufftown - 12 Year Old
DESCRIPTION: This 12-year-old from Dufftown Distillery, in the heart of Speyside, has been matured in European and American oak casks. It was crafted using pure water from Highlandman John's well.

This Wolfburn Single Malt is a 3 year old whisky that has been matured in ex-peated quarter casks from Islay and is a gently peated whisky.  The inaugural whisky was launched globally in March 2016 and has won three gold medal awards in international competitions.
This is an older style bottling of Speyside 10 year old from Benriach.

This is a rare, old-style bottling from Highland Distillery Tullibardine. 
This highland malt is becoming rarer all the time!

A lovely bottling of Glenmorangie 10 year old, with presentation box. The 'original' sets a high standard for Highland whisky, and has gone from strength to strength since its slightly controversial packaging redesign a few years ago.

This Glenfiddich bottling won the Gold Medal at the 2007 International Wine and Spirit Competition.
It has been aged for a total of 12 years in both Oloroso Sherry and Bourbon Cask.

This is an older style bottling of the popular dram, known as 'The single malt that started it all' for Glenlivet.  The Glenlivet 12 Year Old has a soft smooth balance of sweet summer fruits and the floral notes of spring flowers.

Laphroaig  Select has been created using a combination of whisky from a number of different types of cask, including Oloroso Sherry butts, white American oak, Pedro Ximenez seasoned hogsheads, quarter casks and first-fill bourbon casks.
Buchanan's Black & White blended whisky from the 1980s. This is a 75cl bottling.

DISTILLERY / BLENDER: Dimple - 15 Year Old - Fine, Old, Original
DESCRIPTION: This is a 75cl bottling of Haig Dimple 15-year-old blended Whisky.  It is also known as Haig Pinch across the water for our friends in the US.  This blend includes single malts from Glenkinchie and Linkwood.
This is a 12 year old single malt from an undisclosed Highland Distillery.

Gordon Highlanders scotch whisky is a blended whisky.  It is named after the Gordon Highlanders regiment of the British Army.  This bottling celebrates the Bicentenary of the Gordon Highlanders Regiment 1794-1994 which was named after the Clan Gordon.

Matured in first refill American oak and the last year in French oak.
The whisky is said to have a complex nature and bursting with fruitiness finishing with hints of vanilla.

This 12 year old single malt is part of Macallan's Fine Oak, triple cask matured range.  It has been matured for twelve years in three oak cask types; Europen oak seasoned with sherry, American oak seasoned with sherry and American oak seasoned with bourbon.  The Macallan Fine Oak 12 Year Old is medium-bodied and balanced with fruit, oak and spice.
This is a 35cl bottling.

This 12 year old single malt is part of Macallan's Fine Oak, triple cask matured range.  It has been matured for twelve years in three oak cask types; Europen oak seasoned with sherry, American oak seasoned with sherry and American oak seasoned with bourbon.  The Macallan Fine Oak 12 Year Old is medium-bodied and balanced with fruit, oak and spice.
This is a 35cl bottling.
